SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA AND NON-INFLUENZA RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS IN KENYA - INFLUENZA VIRUSES CIRCULATE ANNUALLY, CONSTANTLY UNDERGOING MUTATIONS, WHICH MAY LEAD TO ANTIGENIC DRIFT RENDERING EXISTING THERAPEUTIC AND PREVENTIVE MEDICAL COUNTERMEASURES INEFFECTIVE. INFLUENZA CIRCULATES YEAR-ROUND IN KENYA AND HAS BEEN DETECTED IN HUMANS, POULTRY, AND SWINE. ALTHOUGH HIGHLY PATHOGENIC AVIAN INFLUENZA (HPAI) HAS NOT BEEN DETECTED, KENYA IS HIGHLY SUSCEPTIBLE BECAUSE OF ITS POSITION ALONG MIGRATORY BIRD ROUTES AND PROXIMITY TO OTHER HIGH-RISK COUNTRIES. IN 2007, THE KENYA MINISTRY OF HEALTH (MOH), WITH TECHNICAL SUPPORT FROM CDC AND THE KENYA MEDICAL RESEARCH INSTITUTE (KEMRI), ESTABLISHED A NATIONAL INFLUENZA SENTINEL SURVEILLANCE (ISS) SYSTEM. THE ISS HAS ENABLED KENYA TO DOCUMENT THE BURDEN OF INFLUENZA-ASSOCIATED ILLNESS, CONTRIBUTE TO GLOBAL BURDEN ESTIMATES, INFLUENCE POLICY, MONITOR CHANGES IN CIRCULATING VIRUSES, AND CONTRIBUTE EPIDEMIOLOGICAL AND VIROLOGIC DATA TO WHO GISRS AND SPECIMENS TO THE WHO COLLABORATING CENTER AT CDC. EVEN WITH THE ABOVE SUCCESS, DATA AND SPECIMEN SHARING HAVE HAD CHALLENGES DUE TO LAG IN TESTING/SHIPPING, OTHER COMPETING NATIONAL TESTING PRIORITIES, AND TESTING SUPPLY STOCK-OUTS. IN ADDITION, DATA ARE GENERALLY NOT USED AT THE SUBNATIONAL LEVEL TO INFLUENCE PRIORITY SETTING OR BUDGET ALLOCATIONS TO ENSURE THE GREATEST IMPACT IN KENYA.  THE ISS, THE BACKBONE OF MOH SURVEILLANCE, IS ALSO NOT UTILIZED ROUTINELY FOR SURVEILLANCE OF NON-INFLUENZA RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS WITH PANDEMIC POTENTIAL AND/OR WITH CAPACITY TO CAUSE SEVERE RESPIRATORY ILLNESS. THOUGH IT HAS BEEN LEVERAGED AT TIMES TO DETECT AND RESPOND TO DISEASE OUTBREAKS, INCLUDING NON-INFLUENZA VIRUSES AND BACTERIAL PATHOGENS, LACK OF DEVELOPMENT OF THE ISS BEYOND ROUTINE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE HAS CONTRIBUTED TO A SUB-OPTIMIZED PLATFORM TO SERVE AS AN EARLY WARNING SYSTEM FOR DISEASE OUTBREAKS. IN ADDITION, RECENT EXPERIENCE DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC IDENTIFIED OTHER WEAKNESS IN THE GOVERNMENT OF KENYA’S (GOK) ABILITY TO EXECUTE A STRONG OUTBREAK RESPONSE TO INCLUDE LIMITED HUMAN AND FINANCIAL RESOURCES AND POOR COORDINATION WITHIN/AND AMONG KEY MINISTRIES DUE TO LACK OF A PANDEMIC-PREPAREDNESS FRAMEWORK.  TO RESPOND TO THESE CHALLENGES, HJF MEDICAL RESEARCH INTERNATIONAL, INC. (HJFMRI), THE MOH’S BONA FIDE AGENT FOR THIS SUBMISSION, HAS ASSEMBLED AN OUTSTANDING TEAM THAT INCLUDES THE MOH DISEASE SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE UNIT, MINISTRY OF AGRICULTURE LIVESTOCK AND FISHERIES (MALF), THE ZOONOTIC DISEASES UNIT, KEMRI, AND THE UNIVERSITY OF NAIROBI (UON). WE WILL BUILD THE CAPACITY OF, AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO, MOH AND MALF THROUGH OUR MULTIDISCIPLINARY TEAM, WHICH INCLUDES: HJFMRI PUBLIC HEALTH SCIENTISTS AND ADMINISTRATIVE/PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PERSONNEL; AND KEMRI AND UON VIROLOGISTS, EPIDEMIOLOGISTS, STATISTICIANS/DATA MANAGEMENT PERSONNEL, AND MONITORING AND EVALUATION EXPERTS. WE WILL WORK WITH THE MOH AND CDC TO EXPAND ISS TO INCLUDE EVENT-BASED SURVEILLANCE AND TO: (A) BETTER COLLECT, MAKE USE OF, AND SHARE SURVEILLANCE DATA SUB NATIONALLY, NATIONALLY AND GLOBALLY, AND CAPTURE MORE DATA ON VULNERABLE POPULATIONS; (B) MONITOR CHANGES IN CIRCULATING INFLUENZA VIRUSES AND RESPOND TO HIGHLY PATHOGENIC VARIANTS TRANSMISSIBLE TO HUMANS; (C) ROUTINELY COLLECT DATA ON ZOONOTIC INFLUENZA; (D) RAPIDLY DETECT, CHARACTERIZE, AND MONITOR CHANGES IN NON-INFLUENZA VIRAL AND BACTERIAL RESPIRATORY AND VACCINE-PREVENTABLE PATHOGENS; (E) RESPOND TO OUTBREAKS OF SEVERE RESPIRATORY ILLNESS; AND (F) IMPROVE THE GOK RESPONSE TO POTENTIAL INFECTIOUS DISEASE OUTBREAKS BY ESTABLISHING/OPERATIONALIZING A PANDEMIC-PREPAREDNESS PLAN AND IMPROVING MOH/MALF ONE HEALTH COORDINATION. BY THE END OF THE PERFORMANCE PERIOD WE WILL HAVE STRENGTHENED KENYA’S TECHNICAL, OPERATIONAL, AND INFRASTRUCTURAL CAPACITIES TO PROMPTLY DETECT, REPORT, MONITOR CHANGES IN, AND RESPOND TO INFLUENZA, INCLUDING AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA, AND

THIS PROJECT AIMS TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN CAPACITY OF THE DRC TO CONDUCT ROUTINE SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA AND NO-INFLUENZA RESPIRATORY VIRUS AND BACTERIES. - THIS PROPOSAL IS SUBMITTED BY THE KINSHASA SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH (KSPH) ON BEHALF OF THEDEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO MINISTRY OF HEALTH, DRC/MOH AS A NEW APPLICATIONIN THE FRAMEWORK OF THE NOTICE OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITY (NOFO) NAMED: SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA BY NATIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITIES OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES.                                                                                                                  THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO BUILD CAPACITY OF DRC MINISTRY OF HEALTH FOR ROUTINE INFLUENZA AND OTHER RESPIRATORY DISEASE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS TO MONITOR, DETECT, RESPOND AND MITIGATE TRANSMISSION OF INFLUENZA AND NON-INFLUENZA RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO ENABLE THE DRC/MOH TO MAINTAIN THE INFLUENZA NATIONAL LABORATORY, TO FULLY PARTICIPATE IN THE WHO GLOBAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM (GISRS) AND OTHER EXISTING SURVEILLANCE PLATFORMS TO BE EXPANDED AND UTILIZED FOR RESPONSE TO OUTBREAKS OF PATHOGENS THAT ARE OF PUBLIC HEALTH IMPORTANCE, AND UTILIZING DATA COLLECTED BY THE DRC/MOH  FOR HEALTH CARE POLICY DECISIONS.                                                                                                                                         AS APPROACH, APPROACH, THIS PROPOSAL IS DEVISED INTO THE FOLLOWING 3 COMPONENTS: 1) COMPONENT1: INFLUENZA CORE ACTIVITIES, 2) COMPONENT 2: NON-INFLUENZA VIRAL AND BACTERIAL RESPIRATORY AND VACCINE-PREVENTABLE PATHOGENS; 3) COMPONENT 3: RAPID RESPONSE TO INFECTIOUS DISEASE OUTBREAKS OR OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES. FOR EACH COMPONENT SHORT-TERMS AND LONG-TERMS OUTCOMES HAVE BEEN DESCRIBED AS WELL AS STRATEGIES AND ACTIVITIES. . THOSE COMPONENTS MAINLY FOCUS ON STRATEGIES SUCH AS BUILDING INFRASTRUCTURE, IMPROVING  OF  EPIDEMIOLOGICAL SYSTEM SURVEILLANCE INCLUDING ZOONOTIC DISEASES ; ENHANCING  THE CAPACITY OF LABORATORY FOR TESTING INFLUENZA AND NON-INFLUENZA RESPIRATORY VIRUS ; IMPROVING DATA REPORTING AN D THE COLLABORATION BETWEEN ALL STAKEHOLDERS INVOLVED IN THE SURVEILLANCE AND CONTROL OF INFLUENZA, THE PREPAREDNESS TO FACE POTENTIAL INFLUENZA AND NON-INFLUENZA OUTBREAKS. FIVE-YEAR WORK PLAN  HAS ALSO DESIGNED.

SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA IN MADAGASCAR - THIS PROPOSAL IS BEING SUBMITTED BY THE NATIONAL INFLUENZA CENTER (NIC) MADAGASCAR, A DEPARTMENT OF THE INSTITUT PASTEUR OF MADAGASCAR (IPM) ON BEHALF OF THE MINISTRY OF PUBLIC HEALTH (MOPH) OF THE REPUBLIC OF MADAGASCAR. DESIGNED BY THE WHO AS THE NATIONAL REFERENCE FOR INFLUENZA IN 1978, THE NIC MADAGASCAR IS MEMBERS OF GISRS (GLOBAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM) AND PARTICIPATES ACTIVELY TO THE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SINCE MORE THAN 40 YEARS. THE PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO SUSTAIN NATIONAL INFLUENZA ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED BY THE NIC UNDER PREVIOUS CDC COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT, AND STRENGTH NATIONAL CAPACITIES IN PREPAREDNESS, EARLY DETECTION AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA AS WELL AS EMERGING/RE-EMERGING INFECTIOUS DISEASE WITH POTENTIAL THREATS.THREE GOALS WILL BE ADDRESSED UNDER THIS PROJECT:GOAL 1: TO MAINTAIN AND CONSOLIDATE ROUTINE ILI, SARI AND MORTALITY SURVEILLANCE IN MADAGASCAR TO GENERATE ROBUST DATA SO AS TO SIGNIFICANTLY IMPACT POLICY DEVELOPMENT FOR THE COUNTRY AND POTENTIALLY FOR THE REGION, WHILE WORKING TOWARD DOWN-SCALING AND LONG-TERM SUSTAINABILITY OF THE ILI AND SARI SURVEILLANCE NETWORK IN MADAGASCAR. SINCE OUR BIOLOGICAL SARI SURVEILLANCE DEPENDS ONLY ON TWO SITES, THIS WILL ENTAIL TO REINFORCE THE SARI SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM FROM ITS CURRENT LEVEL IN ORDER TO OBTAIN ROBUST DATA ON HOSPITALIZED SARI PATIENTS WITH PARTICULAR EMPHASIS ON IMPORTANT HIGH-RISK GROUPS. THESE DATA WILL BE USED TO FORMULATE APPROPRIATE POLICIES FOR INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND VACCINATION INTERVENTIONS (ESPECIALLY IN HIGH-RISK GROUPS IN MADAGASCAR) AND ENCOURAGE THE MINISTRY OF PUBLIC HEALTH TO FUND THESE ACTIVITIES IN THE FUTURE.GOAL 2: TO CONSOLIDATE THE LABORATORY CAPACITY SO AS TO SERVE AS NATIONAL AND REGIONAL REFERENCE LABORATORY FOR ZOONOTIC INFLUENZA, TO PROVIDE TRAINING AND SUPPORT TO THE COUNTRY AND REGION, AND TO ESTABLISH ADDITIONAL TECHNOLOGY. THANKS TO THE AGREEMENT BETWEEN IPM AND THE DIRECTION OF VETERINARY SERVICE ( DSV) OF THE MINISTRY OF LIVESTOCK, CLOSE COLLABORATIONS WITH THE ANIMAL HEALTH SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS WILL BE SET UP WITH THE AIM TO MONITOR POTENTIAL ZOONOTIC EMERGENCE OF AVIAN INFLUENZA.GOAL 3: TO USE THE FINDINGS AND EXPERIENCES FROM INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE TO SUSTAIN AND REINFORCE THE DIAGNOSTIC OF COVID-19 IN THE COUNTRY IN ORDER TO INCREASE NATIONAL CAPACITY MANAGEMENT OF SEVERE CASES AND IMPROVE THE COVID-19 SURVEILLANCE. TWO MAIN COMPONENTS ARE ADDRESSED TO REACH THESE GOALS:COMPONENT 1: SURVEILLANCE AND EMERGING DISEASE PREPAREDNESS OF INFLUENZACOMPONENT 2: SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO NON-INFLUENZA RESPIRATORY VIRUSES

SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA IN UGANDA - PROJECT SUMMARYTHE IMPACT OF INFLUENZA INFECTION IN AFRICA IS NOT VERY WELL DOCUMENTED. HOWEVER, THE INFORMATION AVAILABLE SHOWS THAT INFLUENZA HAS A SIGNIFICANT IMPACT ON MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY. IN THE REGION, INFLUENZA VIRUSES ARE IMPORTANT RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS, AND ACUTE RESPIRATORY TRACT INFECTIONS, SUCH AS PNEUMONIA, ARE A MAJOR CAUSE OF DEATH, PARTICULARLY AMONG CHILDREN. IN SUB-SAHARAN AFRICA, MOST OUTBREAKS OF INFLUENZA GO UNREPORTED AND INFORMATION ABOUT CIRCULATING STRAINS IS RELATIVELY LIMITED. ALTHOUGH INFLUENZA HAS BEEN WIDELY STUDIED IN DEVELOPED COUNTRIES, LITTLE IS KNOWN ABOUT ITS EPIDEMIOLOGY, SEASONALITY, AND BURDEN IN DEVELOPING COUNTRIES. IN 2006 FUNDING WAS OBTAINED FROM THE US DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES INFLUENZA BRANCH IN ATLANTA, TO ESTABLISH AN INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE PROGRAM AND DIAGNOSTIC CENTER IN UGANDA. INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE ACTIVITIES WERE STARTED, AND THE UGANDA NATIONAL INFLUENZA CENTER (NIC) WAS REINSTATED AT UGANDA VIRUS RESEARCH INSTITUTE. OVER THE PERIOD OF FIFTEEN YEARS, INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE IN UGANDA HAS BEEN WELL ESTABLISHED. THROUGH THIS PROGRAM, SURVEILLANCE CAPACITIES, AND LABORATORY VIROLOGICAL AND EPIDEMIOLOGICAL CAPACITIES HAVE BEEN DEVELOPED, NOT ONLY FOR INFLUENZA BUT FOR OTHER DISEASES TOO. IT IS CRITICAL THAT THESE CAPACITIES CONTINUE TO BE SUSTAINED AND STRENGTHENED TO ENSURE AN EFFECTIVE NATIONAL SURVEILLANCE BUT ALSO TO PARTICIPATE IN THE GLOBAL DETECTION AND RESPONSE TO PANDEMIC INFLUENZA. THIS PROGRAM IS BENEFICIAL AS IT GENERATES INFORMATION FOR USE IN REDUCING THE MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY ASSOCIATED WITH INFLUENZA AND OTHER RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS. THE PROGRAM WILL COMMUNICATE DATA ON A WEEKLY BASIS TO THE WHO GLOBAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM (GISRS), FLUNET AND FLUID, AND ALSO PROVIDE ISOLATES OF INFLUENZA VIRUS TO THE ATLANTA WHO CC FOR FURTHER DIAGNOSIS AND USE IN VACCINE PRODUCTION.THE PURPOSE OF THIS REQUEST FOR FUNDING IS TO ENABLE UGANDA, THROUGH THE UVRI NATIONAL INFLUENZA CENTER, TO CONTRIBUTE TOWARDS THE PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF INFLUENZA EPIDEMICS AND PANDEMICS BY MAINTAINING AND IMPROVING THE EXISTING ROUTINE INFLUENZA SENTINEL SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM AND DEVELOP CAPACITY TO MONITOR AND QUICKLY RESPOND TO HIGHLY PATHOGENIC VIRUSES AND BACTERIA TRANSMISSIBLE AMONG HUMANS (FROM ANIMALS), AS WELL AS IDENTIFY OUTBREAKS OF SEVERE RESPIRATORY ILLNESS SYNDROMES. ASSESSMENTS AND EVALUATIONS WILL BE CONDUCTED TO GET INFORMATION ON GAPS AND WHERE THERE IS NEED FOR IMPROVEMENTS. THE IDENTIFIED OUTBREAKS WILL BE RESPONDED TO USING A ONE HEALTH MODEL. COMMUNICATION BETWEEN THE MINISTRIES OF HEALTH, MINISTRY OF AGRICULTURE, ANIMAL INDUSTRIES, AND FORESTRY, MINISTRY OF WATER AND ENVIRONMENT AND THE UGANDA WILDLIFE AUTHORITY WILL BE IMPROVED AND PLANS, AND MOUS WILL BE DEVELOPED FOR WORKING TOGETHER ON SURVEILLANCE DISEASE INVESTIGATIONS. THE NATIONAL ONE HEALTH PLATFORM WILL PROVIDE A CHANNEL FOR COMMUNICATION. A TOTAL AMOUNT OF US $ 249,955.00 REQUESTED TO FACILITATE THE ACTIVITIES OF THE THREE COMPONENTS (US $ 140.000 FOR COMPONENT 1; US $ 59,955 FOR COMPONENT 2; AND US $ 50,000 FOR COMPONENT 3.

SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA: EXPANDING RESPIRATORY SURVEILLANCE PROGRAMS IN CAMEROON - THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT THE CAMEROON MINISTRY OF HEALTH IN IMPROVING ITS CAPACITY TO CONDUCT ROUTINE INFLUENZA AND OTHER RESPIRATORY DISEASE SURVEILLANCE IN ORDER TO MONITOR, DETECT, RESPOND, AND MITIGATE TRANSMISSION; IMPROVE LABORATORY SYSTEMS FOR VIROLOGIC DETECTION AND MONITORING; AND STRENGTHEN CONNECTIONS BETWEEN NATIONAL INSTITUTIONS IN ORDER TO FULLY PARTICIPATE IN THE GLOBAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM (GISRS). IN YEAR 1, METABIOTA IN COLLABORATION WITH THE MINISTRY OF HEALTH AIMS TO ACCOMPLISH THE FOLLOWING COMPONENT 1 OUTCOMES IN INFRASTRUCTURE, EPIDEMIOLOGICAL SURVEILLANCE, LABORATORY SURVEILLANCE, PANDEMIC PREPAREDNESS, AND COMPONENT 2 OUTCOMES IN EPIDEMIOLOGICAL SURVEILLANCE, LABORATORY SURVEILLANCE AND VIRAL RESPIRATORY PATHOGEN SURVEILLANCE. IN COMPONENT 1, WE WILL (A) ASSESS INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM AND DEVELOP NATIONAL STRATEGIC PLAN FOR INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE; (B) ESTABLISH/IMPROVE EPIDEMIOLOGIC CAPACITY, ENHANCE EPIDEMIOLOGICAL SURVEILLANCE CAPACITY, AND COORDINATE COMMUNICATION WITH MOA TO IMPLEMENT OR MAINTAIN ANIMAL HUMAN INTERFACE/ONE HEALTH SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM; (C) IMPROVE LABORATORY CAPACITY AND ENHANCE ANIMAL ZOONOTIC INFLUENZA VIRUS KNOWLEDGE TO SUPPORT ANIMAL HUMAN INTERFACE/ONEHEALTH PLATFORM; AND (D) DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN A NATIONAL PANDEMIC INFLUENZA PREPAREDNESS PLAN. IN COMPONENT 2 UNDER EPIDEMIOLOGICAL SURVEILLANCE, WE WILL (A) EVALUATE THE UNUSUAL RESPIRATORY EVENT-BASED SURVEILLANCE (EBS) PIROT PROJECT IMPLEMENTED IN 2017 ? 2018 AND ORGANIZE AN ADVOCACY MEETING TO BUILD COLLABORATION TOWARDS A COORDINATED HUMAN AND ANIMAL SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM; (B) DEVELOP AND REVISE OPERATIONAL GUIDELINES FOR UNUSUAL RESPIRATORY DISEASES (NON-INFLUENZA VIRAL AND BACTERIAL) EBS, UTILIZING A ONE HEALTH APPROACH; (C) BUILD CAPACITY IN FIVE HEALTH FACILITIES TO IMPLEMENT EBS OF UNUSUAL RESPIRATORY DISEASES IN CAMEROON; (D) REVIEW AND DISSEMINATE DATA COLLECTED DURING UNUSUAL RESPIRATORY DISEASE  EBS; AND (E) SUPPORT RAPID RESPONSE TEAMS TO INVESTIGATE OUTBREAKS OF UNUSUAL RESPIRATORY EVENTS.

SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA IN ZAMBIA(CDC-RFA-IP21-2101)PROJECT PROPOSAL (YEAR 1) - INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AMONG CASES OF INFLUENZA-LIKE ILLNESS AND SEVERE ACUTE RESPIRATORYILLNESS (ILI/SARI), IDENTIFIED AT SELECTED SENTINEL HEALTH FACILITIES IN ZAMBIA HAS BEEN ONGOINGSINCE 2008. THE SURVEILLANCE PROGRAM IS MANAGED BY THE NATIONAL INFLUENZA CENTER (NIC) ATTHE UNIVERSITY TEACHING HOSPITALS (UTH) ON BEHALF OF THE MINISTRY OF HEALTH (MOH). THESYSTEM CURRENTLY COMPRISES TEN SENTINEL SITES LOCATED IN FOUR PROVINCES AND CAPTURES DATAFROM BOTH CHILDREN AND ADULTS, RESIDENT IN DENSELY POPULATED URBAN SETTINGS AS WELL AS BORDERTOWNS WITH HIGH TOURISM AND CROSS-BORDER TRADING ACTIVITIES.THE AIM OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT CONTINUED AND IMPROVED INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCEACTIVITIES AS WELL AS TO EXPAND OPERATIONS TO SITES WITH HIGH POTENTIAL FOR ANIMAL TO HUMANTRANSMISSION OF INFECTION. SENTINEL SITES COLLECTING ONLY EPIDEMIOLOGICAL DATA ON ILI/SARICASES WILL ALSO BE ESTABLISHED TO COVER THE REMAINING SIX PROVINCES OF THE COUNTRY. LABORATORYINVESTIGATION FOR CAUSATIVE PATHOGENS WILL ONLY BE DONE IN THESE SIX NEW SITES, IN RESPONSE TOSPECIFIC TRIGGERS SUCH AS AN INCREASED NUMBER OF CASES.CURRENTLY ALL ILI/SARI SAMPLES COLLECTED ARE TESTED FOR BOTH FOR INFLUENZA AND SARS COV 2. INORDER TO GENERATE INFORMATION TO GUIDE THE COVID-19 IMMUNIZATION PROGRAM, A SPECIFICMULTIPLEX ASSAY TARGETING DIFFERENT COVID-19 VARIANTS WILL BE INTRODUCED. LABORATORYMONITORING FOR THE CIRCULATION OF RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS WILL EXTEND TO NON-INFLUENZA ANDOTHER VACCINE PREVENTABLE VIRAL AND BACTERIAL PATHOGENS USING A MULTIPLEX ASSAY. ISOLATION OFINFLUENZA VIRUSES AND SHARING OF ZAMBIAN STRAINS WITH THE GLOBAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE ANDRESPONSE SYSTEM (GISRS) WILL CONTINUE. ULTIMATELY, THE NIC AIMS TO BUILD UPON EXISTING HIGHTHROUGHPUT SANGER SEQUENCING CAPACITY BY ADDING NEXT GENERATION SEQUENCING CAPABILITIES.THIS WILL GREATLY ENHANCE THE COUNTRY?S ABILITY TO GENERATE DETAILED INFORMATION ON CIRCULATINGRESPIRATORY PATHOGENS IN ZAMBIA.ALL OPERATIONS WILL BE TARGETED TOWARDS IMPROVEMENT IN THE QUALITY OF THE DATA COLLECTED. THEPROGRAM WILL MIGRATE TO ELECTRONIC DATA COLLECTION AND USE OF A WEB-BASED PLATFORM TO ENABLEREAL-TIME DATA VISUALISATION. TO MAINTAIN A HIGH QUALITY OF COLLECTED SAMPLES CONTINUOUS COMPETENCE MONITORING AND SUPERVISION OF SENTINEL SITE STAFF WILL BE DONE BY THE NIC.LABORATORIES WILL CONTINUE IMPLEMENTING QUALITY MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS WITH ROUTINEPARTICIPATION IN EXTERNAL QUALITY ASSURANCE PROGRAMS WITH THE WHO AND CDC.THE ZAMBIAN INFLUENZA SENTINEL SURVEILLANCE PROGRAM HAS BEEN SUCCESSFUL IN ITS FIRST TENYEARS OF OPERATION, AND HAS DEMONSTRATED POTENTIAL TO BE STRENGTHENED TO BECOME A REGIONALREFERENCE CENTER IN SOUTHERN AFRICA, ZAMBIA BEING THE HOST COUNTRY FOR THE REGIONALCOLLABORATING CENTRE (RCC) OF THE AFRICA CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (AFRICACDC)

MODEL FOR INTEGRATED INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE IN TAMIL NADU, INDIA (MIISTI) - ACUTE RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS (ARIS) TOP OF THE TABLE FOR MORTALITY AND MORBIDITY AMONG INFECTIOUS DISEASES KILLING ALMOST 4 MILLION PEOPLE EVERY YEAR RESULTING IN AN ECONOMIC LOSS OF 71 TO 167 BILLION US$. VIRUSES CAUSE AROUND 30-70% OF ARIS, WHICH MAY ASSUME EPIDEMIC OR PANDEMIC PROPORTIONS AS IS CURRENTLY HAPPENING WITH THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE INFLUENZA VIRUS ALONE CAUSED 10-20% OF SEVERE ACUTE RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS (SARI). SURVEILLANCE FOR INFLUENZA-LIKE ILLNESS (ILI) AND SARI ARE KEY TO EARLY IDENTIFICATION OF FLU RELATED OUTBREAKS. INDIA, THE 2ND MOST POPULOUS COUNTRY IN THE WORLD IS CURRENTLY REPORTING THE LARGEST NUMBER OF DAILY COVID-19 CASES. AROUND 15.93 MILLION CASES AND 184,687 DEATHS HAVE BEEN REPORTED FROM INDIA SO FAR. INDIA ESTABLISHED ILI AND SARI SURVEILLANCE IN VARIOUS STATES AND STEPPED-UP SURVEILLANCE FOR CASES OF INFLUENZA FROM MARCH 2020 AFTER THE FIRST CASE WAS DETECTED. THE INDIAN COUNCIL OF MEDICAL RESEARCH (ICMR) EXPANDED INDIA?S TESTING CAPACITY FOR COVID-19 FROM A FEW LABORATORIES THEN TO MORE THAN 12000 BY END OF 2020.ALTHOUGH FIGURES OF ILI, SARI AND COVID-19 CASES ARE AVAILABLE, DETAILED INFORMATION ON THE DENOMINATORS AND THE EXTENT OF THESE INFECTIONS ARE NOT KNOWN IN INDIA. THE VETERINARY DEPARTMENT ALSO HAS SURVEILLANCE FOR AVIAN INFLUENZA, BUT IT IS RARELY CONNECTED TO THE HEALTH SYSTEM. WITH EMERGENCE OF COVID-19 TESTING FOR INFLUENZA VIRUSES, NON-INFLUENZA RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS OTHER THAN THOSE CAUSED BY SARS-COV-2 HAS ALMOST BEEN SUSPENDED, EVEN IN THE VIRUS RESEARCH AND DIAGNOSTIC LABORATORIES (N=100 APPROXIMATELY) THAT HAD BEEN ESTABLISHED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH RESEARCH (DHR) ACROSS THE COUNTRY PRIMARILY FOR TIMELY IDENTIFICATION OF VIRUSES OF EPIDEMIC AND/OR BIOTERRORISM POTENTIAL. THIS NATIONAL LEVEL NETWORK IS RARELY CONNECTED TO THE STATE SYSTEMS OTHER THAN SOME REPORTING THROUGH THE INTEGRATED DISEASE SURVEILLANCE PROGRAMME (IDSP) WHICH IS MANAGED BY THE STATES. MOST STATES AND CENTRAL GO VERNMENT DOES NOT CARRY OUT ROUTINE SURVEILLANCE FOR ALL POSSIBLE INFLUENZA AND NON-INFLUENZA ACUTE RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS. THERE IS NO SYSTEM IN PLACE TO CAPTURE EARLY SIGNS OF AN EMERGING OUTBREAK TO TRIGGER ANY IMMEDIATE RESPONSE. EPIDEMIOLOGY (FIELD) AND LABORATORY LINKAGES ARE OFTEN NON-EXISTENT. THERE IS ALSO LACK OF SAMPLE ARCHIVES FROM WHICH FUTURE VACCINES AND DIAGNOSTICS CAN BE DEVELOPED. FURTHERMORE, THE SKILLS AND EXPERTISE OF THE STAFF ENGAGED IN VARIOUS TIERS OF HEALTHCARE, BOTH AT THE PRIVATE AND THE PUBLIC SECTOR, REQUIRE TRAINING ON CURRENT TOOLS AND PRACTICES THAT ARE VITAL IN EPIDEMIOLOGY.TO STRENGTHEN AND INTEGRATE EXISTING SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS AND RESPONSE CAPACITIES FOR PANDEMIC-PRONE DISEASES LIKE INFLUENZA AND NON-INFLUENZA RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS AND TO BUILD A SUSTAINABLE NETWORK FOR EARLY IDENTIFICATION OF OUTBREAKS AND RESPONSE, IT IS PROPOSED TO ESTABLISH A MODEL FOR INTEGRATED INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE IN TAMIL NADU, THE LARGEST STATE IN SOUTH INDIA BY POPULATION (72.1 MILLION), WHICH WOULD HELP EXPAND THE MODEL TO OTHER STATES OF THE COUNTRY AS WELL.THE MODEL USES A FOUR-STEP APPROACH COMPRISING OF (I) ASSESSMENT OF EXISTING SYSTEM TO IDENTIFY PITFALLS, BOTTLENECKS AND GAPS IN INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND TESTING, (II) DEVELOP `PLUG INS? TO ADDRESS THEM, (II) ROLL OUT AND EVALUATE STRENGTHENED SURVEILLANCE (IV) TRANSFER AND DISSEMINATION OF THE BENEFITS FOR SCALE UP AT NATIONAL LEVEL. IT IS EXPECTED THAT OPERATIONALIZATION OF THE MODEL WOULD NOT ONLY SERVE TO IMPROVE CAPACITY AND INFRASTRUCTURE OF HEALTH SYSTEM, BUT IT IS ALSO EXPECTED TO TRIGGER EARLY WARNING SIGNALS FOR IMPENDING OUTBREAKS, ENABLE EARLY ROLL OUT OF PUBLIC HEALTH RESPONSE AND ULTIMATELY MINIMIZE MORBIDITY, MORTALITY AND ECONOMIC IMPACT. THE MODEL IS ALSO EXPECTED TO PROVIDE INFORMATION ON DISEASE TRENDS, BURDEN AND ADVANCED EPIDEMIOLOGICAL CHARACTERISTICS ABOUT ETIOLOGICAL AGENTS OF INFLUENZA AND NON-INFLUENZA RESPIRAT

SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA BY NATIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITIES OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES - THIS PROJECT PRIMARILY AIMS TO STRENGTHEN BHUTAN'S CAPACITY IN SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN, SEASONAL AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA, AND FURTHER WILL ALSO ENABLE TO SUSTAIN THE SURVEILLANCE ACTIVITIES AT LEAST FOR FIVE YEARS. THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS MORE ON STRENGTHENING COORDINATION AND COLLABORATION BETWEEN THE NATIONAL AND GLOBAL SURVEILLANCE NETWORKS. FURTHER, EFFORTS WILL BE PUT IN TO ALIGN THE PROJECT'S KEY ACTIVITIES IN MEETING THE OBJECTIVES OF THE GLOBAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE NETWORK. THE PROJECT WILL BROADLY OPERATE ON THE FOUR STRATEGIES; INFRASTRUCTURE, EPIDEMIOLOGICAL SURVEILLANCE, LABORATORY SURVEILLANCE AND PANDEMIC PREPAREDNESS. IT WILL ALSO ENSURE THAT THE SURVEILLANCE DATA IS EFFECTIVELY TRANSLATED TO INFORMATION THROUGH QUALITY DATA ANALYSIS PROCESS AND THE INFORMATION IS EVENTUALLY USED IN POLICY DECISION MAKING. MONITORING AND EVALUATION (M&E) WILL BE CONSIDERED AS ONE OF THE IMPORTANT TOOLS  TO ASSESS THE PROJECT PROGRESS, AND THE FINDINGS AND RECOMMENDATIONS EMANATED FROM THE M&E WILL BE GIVEN THE TOP PRIORITIES IN ORDER TO EFFICIENTLY IMPLEMENT THE PROJECT'S ACTIVITIES. ALTHOUGH, THE PROJECT IS SPECIFIC TO INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE, EFFORTS WILL UNDERTAKEN TO MAKE IT MORE DYNAMIC AND COMPREHENSIVE IN LIGHT OF LEVERAGING ITS RESOURCES TO RESPOND SIMILAR PANDEMIC. THE LESSONS LEARNT FROM THE CURRENT COVID-19 PANDEMIC WILL REMAIN AS THE VITAL INFORMATION FOR THE PROJECT IN ORDER TO TWEAK ITS ACTIVITIES TO EFFICIENTLY  RESPOND ANY SCALES OF INFLUENZA EVENTS.
SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA BY NATIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITIES OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES - 2021

SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA IN NEPAL (FLUNEPAL) - COMMUNICABLE DISEASES PAUSE THE GREATEST THREAT TO THE GLOBAL HEALTH SECURITY. THE COVID19 PANDEMIC HAS ONCE AGAIN SHOWED THAT HOW VULNERABLE AND UNDERPREPARED IS THE WORLD WHEN IT IS CAUGHT UNAWARE BY A HIGHLY TRANSMISSIBLE AND PATHOGENIC VIRUS. INFLUENZA VIRUS HAVE CAUSED SEVERAL SUCH PANDEMICS AND CONTINUES TO PAUSE THE THREAT OF IMMINENT PANDEMICS DUE TO THEIR UNPREDICTABLE NATURE OF EMERGENCE PARTICULARLY THE ZOONOTIC INFLUENZA VIRUSES INCLUDING AVIAN INFLUENZA. INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE IS ESSENTIAL IN UNDERSTANDING THE MAGNITUDE AND IMPACT OF THESE ANNUAL INFLUENZA EPIDEMICS, TO SELECT INFLUENZA VACCINE COMPONENTS, AND TO DETECT NOVEL INFLUENZA VIRUSES THAT MAY SIGNAL THE START OF A PANDEMIC. THIS PROJECT INTENDED TO STRENGTHEN THE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE IN NEPAL AND TO ENHANCE THE COUNTRY'S PANDEMIC PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE BY ENCOURAGING COLLABORATION AND DATA SHARING BETWEEN HUMAN AND ANIMAL HEALTH SECTORS. THE EXISTING NATIONAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM WILL BE ASSESSED AND REVIEWED CRITICALLY BOTH IN TERMS OF EPIDEMIOLOGY AND LABORATORY CAPACITY TO IDENTIFY THE GAPS AND NEEDS. BASED ON THE GAPS THE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM WILL BE STRENGTHENED TO PROVIDE BETTER GEOGRAPHICAL REPRESENTATION AND ACCESS TO LABORATORY CAPACITY. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO ENABLE DEVELOPMENT OF A COHORT OF HUMAN RESOURCES AT VARIOUS LEVELS TO PROVIDE THE COUNTRY WITH MANPOWER WITH SKILLS REQUIRED TO PLAN, EXECUTE, COLLECT DATA, ANALYZE DATA TO PROVIDE EVIDENCE FOR POLICY MAKERS.  BUILDING ON THE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM, SURVEILLANCE AND DISEASE OUTBREAK AS WELL AS EMERGENCE OF NOVEL PATHOGENS WILL ALSO BE STRENGTHENED. THIS CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT IS EXPECTED SIGNIFICANTLY ENHANCE NEPAL'S CAPACITY TO RESPOND TO PUBLIC HEALTH THREAT OF EMERGING DISEASES AND PANDEMICS WHILE CONTRIBUTING TOWARDS GLOBAL HEALTH SECURITY.

MAINTENANCE CAMBODIA?S INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE NETWORKS AND RESPONSE TO SEASONAL AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA - CAMBODIA REPORTED 56 HUMAN A/H5N1 CASES WITH 37 DEATHS, PARTICULARLY THE HIGHEST NUMBER OF H5N1 CASES WERE REPORTED IN 2013 AND 2014. IT WAS NOTED THAT H1N1PDM09 INCREASED IN THE FIRST 6 MONTHS IN 2016. ONE BIG OUTBREAK OF H1N1PDM09 WAS REPORTED IN PREY VENG PROVINCE, THAT SHARE BORDER TO VIETNAM. A VERY SEVERE CASE OF H1N1PDM09 WAS DETECTED IN A MAN WHO WORKED AT LOCAL TV STATION. THE CASE WAS ADMITTED IN SARI SENTINEL SITE (KHMER SOVIET HOSPITAL) AND DIED AFTER 7 DAYS OF ONSET. FURTHERMORE, INFLUENZA A/H1N1PDM09 CASES WERE FROM SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM IN CAMBODIA, IN 2020, 150 AND 104 OF A/H1N1PDM09 CASES FROM ILI AND SARI SURVEILLANCES. IN ADDITION, CAMBODIA SEVERAL INFLUENZA A/H3N2 CLUSTERS OUTBREAK DETECTED IN 2020. THERE WERE 305 OF A/H3N2 POSITIVE IN 589 SPECIMENS COLLECTED FROM NINE PRISONS IN COUNTRY. THERE ARE ALSO A/H3N2 CLUSTER OUTBREAK OCCURRED IN CLOSE COMMUNITY, MONASTERY, THERE WERE 111 POSITIVES OF A/H3N2 IN 125 SAMPLES COLLECTED. UNDER THE FIRST AND SECOND FIVE-YEAR HHS/CDC COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (COAG), THE NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF PUBLIC HEALTH (NIPH) COOPERATED WITH US CDC TO ESTABLISHED INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS TO DETECT AND RESPOND TO SEASONAL, AVIAN, PANDEMIC INFLUENZA, AND OUTBREAKS. FURTHERMORE, THE SYSTEM HAS EXPANDED AND STRENGTHENED LABORATORY AND EPIDEMIOLOGY HUMAN CAPACITY. HOWEVER, GAPS IN SURVEILLANCE CAPACITY REMAIN. THEREFORE, NIPH IS APPLYING FOR ADDITIONAL CDC FUNDING THROUGH THIS NEW 5-YEAR COAG TO HELP TO FILL THESE GAPS AS WELL AS TO MAINTAIN EXISTING SU RVEILLANCE ACTIVITIES. THE GOAL OF THE NEW COAG IS TO MAINTAIN CURRENT INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM TO DETECT AND RESPOND TO PANDEMIC AND NOVEL VIRUSES AND STRENGTHENING NATIONAL REFERENCE LABORATORY CENTER. TO ACHIEVE THIS GOAL, THE NEW FIVE YEARS COAG MAINLY FOCUS ON MAINTAINING A NATIONAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE CAPACITIES TO DETECT, MONITOR, RESPOND AND MITIGATE TRANSMISSION OF NOVEL INFLUENZA VIRUSES AND ENABLING THE NATIONAL PUBLIC HEALTH LABORATORY (NPHL) TO BE A WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION (WHO) NATIONAL INFLUENZA CENTER (NIC).OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROPOSAL ARE: 1) TO MAINTAIN THE CAPACITY OF EPIDEMIOLOGISTS IN ROUTINE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE, ANALYSIS, AND OUTBREAK PREPAREDNESS & RESPONSE; 2) TO MAINTAIN AN INFORMATION MANAGEMENT SYSTEM THAT PRODUCES USEFUL DATA FOR SURVEILLANCE OBJECTIVE AN INFORMATION MANAGEMENT SYSTEM FOR INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE DATA; 3) TO MAINTAIN SENTINEL SURVEILLANCE FOR SARI AND ILI BY EVALUATING THE LEVEL OF QUALITY & UTILITY FOR SURVEILLANCE OBJECTIVES AND ANALYSIS; 4) TO MAINTAIN INFLUENZA TESTING CAPACITY AT THE NATIONAL INFLUENZA LABORATORY THROUGH EXTERNAL QUALITY REVIEW, MANAGEMENT AND TRAINING; 5) TO PARTICIPATION AND SHARE INFLUENZA VIRUSES WITH WHO GLOBAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM (GISRS) VIA THE WHO COLLABORATING CENTERS; 6) TO MAINTAIN SURVEILLANCE FOR OUTBREAKS OF SEVERE RESPIRATORY AND FEBRILE ILLNESSES; AND 7) TO PARTICIPATE WITH CDC?S INFLUENZA DIVISION IN RELEVANT MEETINGS, ASSESSMENTS, DISCUSSIONS AND OTHER OPPORTUNITIES AS THEY MAY ARISETO RESPOND TO THESE OBJECTIVES, NPHL AND CAMBODIA CDC HAS TO CONDUCT SEVERAL PRIORITIZED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING ORGANIZING A CONSULTATIVE MEETING WITH ALL RELEVANT STAKEHOLDERS TO REVIEW INFLUENZA AND FEBRILE ILLNESS SURVEILLANCE SOP, CONDUCTING REFRESHER TRAINING ON SPECIMEN COLLECTION, PACKAGING, AND TRANSPORT, CONDUCTING WORKSHOP ON PROBLEMS IDENTIFICATION AND SOLVING, SUPERVISING AND PR

SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA IN VIETNAM - THE NATIONAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM (NISS) IN VIETNAM WAS ESTABLISHED IN 2006 UNDER COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WITH US CDC, AND GRADUALLY BECAME NATIONAL ROUTINE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM IN THE COUNTRY. THE COMPONENTS PROPOSED AND APPLIED FOR THIS FUNDING OPPORTUNITY ARE DESIGNED TO MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE THE CURRENT EXISTING NISS FOR BOTH EPIDEMIOLOGICAL SURVEILLANCE AND LABORATORY CAPACITY. IF AWARDED, THE PURPOSES OF THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ARE TO IMPROVE QUALITY OF THE EXISTING INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND ENHANCE ANIMAL-HUMAN HEALTH SECTOR COLLABORATION IN SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA IN VIETNAM. THE PROJECT CONSISTS OF TWO COMPONENTS, THE FIRST COMPONENT COVERS INFLUENZA CORE ACTIVITIES DESIGNED TO MAINTAIN AND ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF EXISTING NISS AND THE SECOND COMPONENT CONTAINS ACTIVITIES TO ENHANCE CAPACITY OF THE NISS FOR NON INFLUENZA PATHOGEN SURVEILLANCE. THE FIRST INTENT IS TO IMPROVE CAPACITY OF THE ROUTINE SURVEILLANCE TO MONITOR INFLUENZA ACTIVITY AND TO DETECT AND RESPOND TO ANY SIGNAL OF A PANDEMIC INFLUENZA. THE SECOND INTENT IS TO STRENGTHEN HUMAN-ANIMAL COLLABORATION IN AVIAN INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE TO DETECT ANIMAL INFLUENZA HUMAN INFECTIONS FOR EARLY RESPONSE. THE THIRD INTENT IS TO SUPPORT NISS TO FULLY PARTICIPATE IN THE WHO GLOBAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM (GISRS) THROUGH REGULAR INFLUENZA INFORMATION REPORTING, AND TO PROMOTE THE NATIONAL INFLUENZA CENTERS (NIC) TO MAINTAIN CAPACITY TO SHARE INFLUENZA POSITIVE SAMPLES TO WHO-CC ON REGULAR BASIS. THE SECOND COMPONENT IS DESIGNED TO EXTEND CAPACITY TO DETECT AND MONITOR NON INFLUENZA PATHOGENS THAT PRESENT A POTENTIAL RISK FOR OUTBREAK IN HUMAN, ESPECIALLY HIGHLY PATHOGENIC AVIAN INFLUENZA VIRUSES.

SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA BY NATIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITIES OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES - VIROLOGIC AND EPIDEMIOLOGIC SURVEILLANCE ARE ESSENTIAL FOR DETECTING      NEW INFLUENZA VIRUS VARIANTS MONITORING PUBLIC HEALTH IMPACT AND GENERATING DATA REQUIRED FOR VACCINE DEVELOPMENT. HAVING A ROBUST VIROLOGIC SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM ENSURES THE RAPID DETECTION OF HUMAN INFECTIONS WITH NOVEL INFLUENZA AND OTHER RESPIRATORY VIRUSES, AND CONSEQUENTLY, THE PROMPT CHARACTERIZATION OF VIRUSES AND THEIR VARIANTS. SUCH ENABLES THE TIMELY AND APPROPRIATE IMPLEMENTATION OF PUBLIC HEALTH RESPONSES FOR DISEASE CONTROL.IN THE PHILIPPINES, INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE HAS BEEN WELL-ESTABLISHED FOR SEVERAL YEARS, WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH TAKING THE LEAD THROUGH THE PHILIPPINE NATIONAL INFLUENZA CENTER LODGED AT THE RESEARCH INSTITUTE FOR TROPICAL MEDICINE AND WITH SUPPORT FROM PARTNERS SUCH AS THE WHO AND THE CDC.  CURRENTLY, FIVE (5) SUBNATIONAL LABORATORIES, TWO IN THE NATIONAL CAPITAL REGION, ONE IN THE CORDILLERA ADMINISTRATIVE REGION, ONE IN REGION VII AND ONE IN REGION XI ARE FUNCTIONAL. HOWEVER, THE EXISTING SURVEILLANCE CAPACITY OF THE COUNTRY HAS TO BE SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASED TO BE ABLE TO RAPIDLY IDENTIFY TRENDS IN SARS-COV-2 COMMUNITY TRANSMISSION, AND CONSEQUENTLY HOT SPOTS OF DISEASE TRANSMISSION; IMPLEMENT COMMUNITY MITIGATION MEASURES; AND IN THE LONG RUN, MONITOR DISEASE TRENDS.THIS PROPOSAL, ENTITLED ?SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA BY NATIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITIES OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES?, HAS TWO OBJECTIVES: (1) TO EXPAND THE CAPACITY OF LABORATORY TESTING TO BE ABLE TO INCLUDE SARS-COV-2 DETECTION AND GENOMIC SEQUENCING; AND (2) TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF SENTINEL SITES.GENOMIC SEQUENCING WILL ENABLE OUR LABORATORIES TO IDENTIFY NOVEL PATHOGENS AND VIRUS MUTATIONS FROM ILI/SARI SURVEILLANCE SAMPLES AND TO MONITOR INFLUENZA VIRUS EVOLUTION AND EPIDEMIOLOGY. IN ESTABLISHING NEW ILI SENTINEL SITES IN MAJOR INTERNATIONAL AIRPORTS AND SEAPORTS AND SARI SENTINEL SITES IN THIRTEEN REGIONAL HOSPITALS, WE WILL NOT ONLY ENHA NCE OUR TESTING CAPACITY FOR INFLUENZA AND OTHER RESPIRATORY VIRUSES BUT WILL ALSO IMPROVE OUR MONITORING OF VIRAL MUTATIONS DUE TO IMPORTATION AND LOCAL TRANSMISSION. LIKEWISE, THE PNIC PLAN TO REVIVE AND STRENGTHEN THE COLLABORATION WITH DENR AND DA TO ESTABLISH A FUNCTIONAL AND SUSTAINABLE MECHANISM TO STRENGTHEN COORDINATION AMONG ANIMAL-HUMAN HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT SECTORS FOR THE EFFECTIVE PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF ZOONOTIC DISEASES.THIS ENHANCEMENT OF THE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM WILL PROVIDE IMPROVED VIROLOGIC SURVEILLANCE DATA AND BETTER PREPARE THE COUNTRY IN RESPONDING TO OUTBREAKS AND FUTURE PANDEMICS.

SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA BY NATIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITIES OF PARAGUAYTHE PROPOSAL OF PARAGUAY WILL BE BASED ON COMPONENTS 1 AND 2 - THE CURRENT SARS COV-2 PANDEMIC HAS DEMONSTRATED THE IMPORTANCE OF HAVING ROBUST SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS. WHAT IS MORE, EACH SEASON OF INFLUENZA BECOMES A CHALLENGE FOR SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS, SINCE NONE IS EQUAL TO ANOTHER IN TERMS OF MAGNITUDE AND SEVERITY, CAUSING SERIOUS CONSEQUENCES EACH YEAR IN HEALTH SYSTEMS AND THE ECONOMY. TO THIS IS ADDED THE CONSTANT THREAT OF A NEW PANDEMIC. THIS IS WHY COUNTRIES MUST MAINTAIN THEIR CAPACITY TO CONDUCT ROUTINE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND DETECT AND RESPOND TO HIGHLY PATHOGENIC VIRUSES TRANSMISSIBLE AMONG HUMANS, INCLUDING EPIDEMIOLOGIC AND VIROLOGIC DETECTION AND TO RESPOND AND MONITOR INFLUENZA VIRUS CHANGES, AS WELL AS IDENTIFY OUTBREAKS OF SEVERE RESPIRATORY ILLNESS SYNDROMES.THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO OBTAIN SUPPORT TO MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE THE RESULTS OF THE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM. ANOTHER PURPOSE IS TO STRENGTHEN TIES WITH THE NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL NETWORK, ESPECIALLY THE WHO, BY PARTICIPATING IN THE GLOBAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE NETWORK AND SHARING STRAINS, CLINICAL, AND EPIDEMIOLOGICAL DATA. FINALLY, THE OPPORTUNITY WILL SUPPORT THE MONITORING HIGHLY PATHOGENIC VIRUSES AND BACTERIA TRANSMISSIBLE TO HUMANS AND IDENTIFICATION OF OUTBREAKS OF SEVERE RESPIRATORY ILLNESS.  THE ACTIVITIES PRESENTED IN THE PROPOSAL ARE ALIGNED WITH THE PRIORITIES OF STRENGTHENING THE GLOBAL CAPACITY TO PREVENT, DETECT, AND RESPOND TO OUTBREAKS OF THE DISEASE AND OTHER EVENTS WITH POTENTIAL RISK TO PUBLIC HEALTH, SUCH AS AN INFLUENZA PANDEMIC. IMPROVING AND MAINTAINING THE COUNTRY'S SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM AND ITS NETWORK CAN IMPACT THE MONITORING AND DETECTION CAPACITY OF A NEW VIRUS, WHICH IN TURN COULD MITIGATE THE POTENTIALLY DEVASTATING EFFECT OF AN INFLUENZA PANDEMIC.THE PROPOSAL OF PARAGUAY WILL BE BASED ON COMPONENTS 1 AND 2:1) TO BUILD AND/OR MAINTAIN INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND MONITOR NOVEL VIRUSES IN ANIMALS (INFLUENZA ACTIVITIES); 2) TO IMPLEMENT NON-INFLUENZA PATHOGEN SURVEILLANCE (NON-INFL UENZA VIRAL AND BACTERIAL RESPIRATORY AND VACCINE-PREVENTABLE PATHOGEN).

INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE DEPARTMENT, NATIONAL AGENCY FOR PUBLIC HEALTH, REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA - DURING THE LAST YEARS, THE U.S. CENTERS OF DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (CDC) HAS WORKED WITH THE MINISTRY OF HEALTH, LABOR AND SOCIAL PROTECTION (MHLSP) AND NATIONAL COUNTERPARTS FROM THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA TO BUILD CAPACITIES FOR PANDEMIC PREPAREDNESS, COMMUNICATION, SURVEILLANCE, MONITORING, EARLY RESPONSE, AND INFECTION CONTROL OF INFLUENZA. THROUGH THIS PROJECT, NATIONAL AGENCY FOR PUBLIC HEALTH (NAPH) WILL: STRENGTHEN THE LABORATORY-BASED SENTINEL-SITE SURVEILLANCE; STRENGTHEN THE HOSPITAL-BASED SURVEILLANCE SENTINEL-SITES; COLLECT AND SUBMIT ELECTRONICALLY WEEKLY INFLUENZA-SURVEILLANCE INFORMATION TO WHO THROUGH TESSY NETWORK; SUBMIT WEEKLY 2 REPORTS (1 ? SENTINEL REPORT, 1 ? NATIONAL REPORT) TO THE LOCAL AND NATIONAL AUTHORITIES IN ORDER TO EVALUATE THE TRENDS OF DISEASES AND IMPLEMENT PUBLIC HEALTH MEASURE; SEND SAMPLES FOR CONFIRMATION AND QUALITY CONTROL ASSURANCE OF LABORATORY TESTING TO WHO COLLABORATIVE CENTER FOR INFLUENZA IN LONDON, UK ANNUALLY. THE NATIONAL VIRAL LABORATORY (NVL) HAS INTERNAL QUALITY CONTROL PROCEDURES AND PARTICIPATES IN EXTERNAL QUALITY CONTROL PROGRAMS IN WHO CC LONDON, WHO CC HONG KONG AND WHO CC ATLANTA. THE NVL FULFILLED THE TERMS OF REFERENCE OF A NATIONAL INFLUENZA CENTER (NIC) AND WAS DESIGNATED BY WHO AS A NIC IN 2013. THUS, THE TARGETED EXTERNAL FUNDING FROM THE CDC COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT HELPED TO IMPROVE THE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM BY STRENGTHENING THE EXISTING THE HOSPITAL-BASED SURVEILLANCE AND ESTABLISHING LABORATORY?BASED SURVEILLANCE. THIS ALLOWED TO ENSURE ADEQUATE MONITORING AND TO OBTAIN HIGH QUALITY DATA. HOWEVER, IT IS CRITICAL THAT THESE NEW CAPACITIES BE SUSTAINED AND STRENGTHENED OVER TIME. OBJECTIVES AND TECHNICAL APPROACH PROJECT AIMS: STRENGTHENING THE CAPACITIES FOR RAPID DETECTION AND RESPONSE TO POTENTIAL PANDEMIC INFLUENZA AS WELL AS FOR MONITORING THE OCCURRENCE AND ASSESSING THE IMPACT OF SEASONAL INFLUENZA IN THE COUNTRY THROUGH ENHANCING THE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM AND CO NTROL AND IMPROVING PANDEMIC PREPAREDNESS IN THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA. MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT: 1. STRENGTHENING THE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE, CONTROL SYSTEM AND MONITORING OF INFLUENZA VIRUSES CIRCULATION IN THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA; 2. TO DEVELOP THE CAPACITY FOR DETECTING NON-INFLUENZA VIRAL AND BACTERIAL RESPIRATORY AND VACCINE-PREVENTABLE PATHOGENTHE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES: 1.WORK WITH CASE DEFINITIONS WITH FAMILY DOCTORS AND INFECTIONISTS FOR ILI, ARI, SARI AND OTHER RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS.2.PERMANENT MONITORING OF NATIONAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND CONTROL SYSTEM REGARDING EPIDEMIOLOGICAL AND VIROLOGICAL DATA COLLECTION, ANALYSIS, REPORTING, INFORMATION SHARING AND IMPLEMENTATION PUBLIC HEALTH MEASURES; 3.ANALYZE AND PUBLISH DATA FROM THE NATIONAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM IN ORDER TO PREDICT THE TRANSMISSION BASED ON PREVIOUS PATTERNS OF SPREAD, VIRUS CIRCULATION AND SEASONALITY AND TO TAKE THE PREPAREDNESS MEASURES; 4.STRENGTHEN AND MAINTAIN VIROLOGICAL SENTINEL SURVEILLANCE FOR SARI, ARI AND ILI AND OTHER RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS IN REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA; 5.STRENGTHEN AND MAINTAIN CAPACITIES FOR THE DETECTION OF INFLUENZA AND NON-INFLUENZA VIRUSES AT THE NATIONAL VIRAL LABORATORY; 6.SHARE SAMPLES WITH INFLUENZA VIRUSES WITH WHO GLOBAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM (GISRS) VIA THE WHO COLLABORATION CENTER;7.STRENGTHEN AND MAINTAIN NATIONAL-ROUTINE AND SENTINEL ILI, ARI, SARI AND OTHER RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS REPORTING AS PART 8.IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN AN INFORMATION MANAGEMENT SYSTEM FOR INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE DATA; 9.MAINTAIN THE CAPACITY OF EPIDEMIOLOGIST IN ROUTINE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE, ANALYSIS AND OUTBREAK RESPONSE BY ORGANIZING ANNUALLY TRAININGS; 10.IMPROVE AWARENESS OF PANDEMIC INFLUENZA PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE CAPACITIES.

STRENGTHENING SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA BY NATIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITIES OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES - SOMALIA HAS A WEAK HEALTH SYSTEM, OWING TO THREE DECADES OF PROTRACTED CONFLICT AND THE REGULAR OCCURRENCE OF NATURALS HAZARDS, INCLUDING FLOODS, DROUGHT AND CYCLONE. WITH AN ESTIMATED POPULATION OF 15 MILLION PEOPLE, OF WHOM 6 MILLION NEED URGENT HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE, THE COUNTRY HAS ONE OF THE LOWEST HEALTH INDICATORS IN THE WORLD. OF THESE, 2.6 MILLION LIVE IN INTERNALLY DISPLACED PEOPLE(IDP)CAMPS, WITH LIMITED ACCESS TO SAFE WATER, PROPER SANITATION, FOOD AND PRIMARY HEALTH CARE SERVICES MAKING THESE CAMPS AN IDEAL SETTING FOR OUTBREAKS OF INFLUENZA AND OTHER PATHOGENS.DESPITE AN ASSESSMENT CONDUCTED IN 2019 BY THE REGIONAL OFFICE OF THE WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION(WHO)FOR THE EAST MEDITERRANEAN REGION(EMR)POINTING TO THE NECESSITY OF HAVING AN INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE, SUCH SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM HAS NOT BEEN ESTABLISHED IN SOMALIA. THE EXISTING EARLY WARNING ALERT AND RESPONSE NETWORK (EWARN)IS ONLY IMPLEMENTED IN HALF OF ALL HEALTH FACILITIES, MAKING IT DIFFICULT TO DETECT EMERGING INFECTIONS FROM OTHER LOCATIONS. THERE IS ALSO LIMITED COORDINATION BETWEEN THE ANIMAL AND HEALTH SECTOR PLAYERS FOR THE TIMELY DETECTION AND INVESTIGATION OF EPIDEMIC PRONE DISEASES WHICH HAS A ZOONOTIC LINKAGE. FINALLY, THE PRESENCE OF RAPID RESPONSE TEAMS AND COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKERS WHO INVESTIGATE COMMUNITY ALERTS AND FOLLOW UP ON CONTACT OF CONFIRMED CASES, NEEDS TO BE SCALED UP TO DISTRICTS WHICH ARE PRONE TO EPIDEMIC PRONE DISEASES.THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ESTABLISH AND STRENGTHEN THE INTEGRATED SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM IN SOMALIA FOR AVIAN, SEASONAL AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE OVERALL REDUCTION IN AVOIDABLE MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY RESULTING FROM INFLUENZA, EPIDEMIC PRONE RESPIRATORY DISEASES AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES WITHIN SOMALIA. THE FIVE-YEAR PROJECT (30 SEPT. 2021-29 SEPT 2026) WILL FOCUS ON THREE COMPONENTS NAMELY:- COMPONENT 1 ? INFLUENZA CORE ACTIVITIES: WILL FOCUS ON THE IMPLEMENTATION OF INFLUENZA CORE ACTI VITIES FOR SEASONAL AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA THROUGH ESTABLISHING AN INTEGRATED SARI/ILI SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM. THIS COMPONENT WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE ANIMAL HEALTH SECTOR TO CONDUCT SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE ACTIVITIES FOR AVIAN INFLUENZA WITH EPIDEMIC AND PANDEMIC POTENTIALS. UNDER THIS COMPONENT, SUPPORT WILL BE PROVIDED FOR THE COLLECTION OF QUALITY EPIDEMIOLOGICAL AND VIROLOGIC SURVEILLANCE DATA IN A TIMELY MANNER AND THE ANALYSIS OF DATA USEFUL FOR DECISION-MAKING FOR THE PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF PANDEMIC AND SEASONAL INFLUENZA. THIS COMPONENT WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE SHARING OF INFLUENZA SPECIMENS WITH GISRS FOR SEASONAL INFLUENZA VACCINE STRAIN SELECTION AS WELL AS OF AVIAN INFLUENZA VIRUS WITH EPIDEMIC POTENTIALS WITH THE CONCERNED ANIMAL HEALTH LABORATORY.  - COMPONENT 2 ? NON-INFLUENZA VIRAL AND BACTERIAL RESPIRATORY AND VACCINE-PREVENTABLE PATHOGEN ACTIVITY: WILL FOCUS ON THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM FOR THE TIMELY DETECTION AND RESPONSE TO NON INFLUENZA VIRAL AND BACTERIAL RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS AND VACCINE PREVENTABLE PATHOGENS USING THE EXISTING SARI SURVEILLANCE PLATFORMS. SUPPORT WILL ALSO BE PROVIDED THROUGH THIS COMPONENT ON BURDEN ANALYSIS AS WELL AS CAPACITY BUILDING FOR CRITICAL CARE SUPPORT.- COMPONENT 3 ? RAPID RESPONSE TO INFECTIOUS DISEASE OUTBREAKS OR OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES:  WILL FOCUS ON STRENGTHENING THE DETECTION AND RESPONSE CAPACITY OF THE LOCAL AND NATIONAL HEALTH SECTOR FOR EPIDEMICS AND OTHER HEALTH EMERGENCIES THROUGH SURGE DEPLOYMENT, ESTABLISHING COMMUNITY-BASED AND EVENT-BASED SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM AND ALSO THROUGH REGULAR AFTER ACTION REVIEWS.EACH COMPONENT HAS SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES, ACTIVITIES, OUTPUTS, OUTCOMES THAT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED AND MEASURED OVER THE PERIOD OF 5 YEARS AGAINST THE SET TARGETS. BY THE END OF THE PROJECT, AN INTEGRATED SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM FOR INFLUENZA WILL BE ESTABLISHED AND VARIOUS

STRENGTHENING THE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM OF INFLUENZA AND NON INFLUENZA RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS IN TUNISIA: PHASE 3, BUILDING CAPACITIES AND SUSTAINABILITY - THE PRESENT PROJECT AIMS TO STRENGTHEN THE ACHIEVEMENTS AND ENSURE A QUALITY IMPROVEMENT IN ALL ASPECTS AS WELL AS A PROGRESS TOWARDS SUSTAINABILITY AND INTEGRATION OF THE INFLUENZA AND OTHER RESPIRATORY VIRUSES SYSTEM FOR AN OPTIMAL PERFORMANCE AND CAPACITY TO CONTROL EPIDEMICS AT DETECT PANDEMIC THREATS. IN AGREEMENT WITH US-CDC VISION, WE EXPECT TO:1. OBTAIN A PARSIMONIOUS QUALITY-BASED ELECTRONIC SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM OF INFLUENZA AND OTHER RESPIRATORY VIRUSES INTEGRATING PERTINENT STAKEHOLDERS AT THE MINISTRIES OF HEALTH AND AGRICULTURE, DECENTRALIZED, LINKING STAKEHOLDERS AND SECTORS FOR TIMELY SHARING OF EPIDEMIOLOGIC AND INFORMATION CIRCULATING VIRUSES AND CAPABLE OF PRODUCING PERTINENT INFORMATION FOR AN EVIDENCE-BASED CONTROL STRATEGY AND RESPONSE TO PANDEMIC THREATS. 2. ADDRESS A BIG GAP IDENTIFIED IN PREVIOUS SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM THAT CONSIST OF THE WEAK IDENTIFICATION OF CIRCULATING RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS WHICH WILL MOST LIKELY INCLUDE PANDEMIC RELATED PATHOGENS AND UPGRADE THE SURVEILLANCE TO THE LEVEL OF THE ACCURATE IDENTIFICATION OF ETIOLOGICAL AGENTS AND THEIR DISTRIBUTION OVER TIME IN REPRESENTATIVE AREAS OF TUNISIA.3. TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITIES, COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS TO DETECT AT AN EARLY STAGE THE EPIDEMIC/PANDEMIC THREATS AND TO ENABLE CONTROL TEAMS TO RESPOND TIMELY AND ADEQUATELY.4.  TO SHARE THE EPIDEMIOLOGIC/BIOLOGICAL INFORMATION IN REAL TIME WITH PARTNERS, UN AGENCIES AND THE US-CDC.THIS PROPOSAL AIMS TO PROMOTE QUALITY AND PROGRESS TOWARDS SUSTAINABILITY AND ONE HEALTH APPROACH USING MULTI-SECTORAL TRANSDISCIPLINARY APPROACHES. IT INTEGRATES IN THE SAME ELECTRONIC PLATFORM EPIDEMIOLOGICAL, CLINICAL AND BIOLOGICAL SURVEILLANCE DATA FOR TIMELY SHARING AND EVIDENCE-BASED DECISIONS BY DIFFERENT STAKEHOLDERS. A STEERING COMMITTEE, SUPPORTED BY TECHNICAL AD-HOC COMMITTEES AND  RECOGNIZED EXPERTS, REPRESENTING A CONSORTIUM OF PUBLIC HEALTH INSTITUTIONS, INCLUDING A NETWORK OF CERTIFIED LABORATORIES IN CHARGE OF INFLUENZA AN D NON-INFLUENZA RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS SURVEILLANCE, AND SUPPORTED BY THE MINISTRIES  OF HEALTH AND AGRICULTURE, ENSURES GOVERNANCE, IMPLEMENTATION AND EVALUATION OF THE PROJECT. ULTIMATELY, THIS SYSTEM WILL BE SUSTAINABLE AND MOST APPROPRIATE FOR INFLUENZA AND NON-INFLUENZA RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS SURVEILLANCE AND CONTROL AS WELL AS PANDEMIC PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE.

MAINTAIN NATIONAL INFLUENZA SENTINEL SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM IN MALI - THIS PROJECT IS INTENDED TO MAINTAIN THE MALIAN INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM AND DEVELOP DEVELOP CAPACITY OF TESTING OTHER RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS IN MALI. THE OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT ARE THE FOLLOWINGS:- ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF EPIDEMIOLOGISTS IN ROUTINE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND OUTBREAK RESPONSE.- MAINTAIN AN INFORMATION MANAGEMENT SYSTEM FOR SURVEILLANCE DATA,- MAINTAIN ENHANCED SENTINEL SURVEILLANCE FOR SARI AND ILI,- MAINTAIN ENHANCED INFLUENZA TESTING AND REPORTING CAPACITY AT THE NATIONAL LABORATORY,- MAINTAIN ENHANCED NATIONAL ROUTINE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE REPORTING,- ESTABLISH SEASONALITY, EPIDEMIOLOGY AND DATA FOR DISEASE BURDEN FOR INFLUENZA AND OTHER RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS.

SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA BY NATIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITIES OUTSIDE UNITED STATES - ABSTRACT/EXECUTIVE SUMMARYTHE RATE OF DEVELOPMENT AND NETWORKING ACROSS THE GLOBE HAVE IMMENSELY CONTRIBUTED TO THE SPREAD OF DISEASES FROM ONE COUNTRY TO ANOTHER. IN ADDITION, GLOBALISATION FACILITATES THE RAPID SPREAD OF INFECTIOUS DISEASES, WHETHER EMERGING OR RE-EMERGING. INFLUENZA HAS BEEN KNOWN HISTORICALLY FOR ITS PANDEMIC POTENTIAL AND THEREFORE REQUIRES ACTIVE AND PERSISTENT SURVEILLANCE. SEASONAL, ZOONOTIC AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA ARE THE TYPES OF INFLUENZA OUTBREAKS THAT OCCUR IN HUMANS AND ANIMALS. THE MOST COMMON AMONG ANIMALS IS THE AVIAN INFLUENZA WHICH AFFECTS BIRDS. THE VARIOUS SUBTYPES OF INFLUENZA TYPE A VIRUS (AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA) HAVE PANDEMIC POTENTIALS BECAUSE OF THEIR ABILITY TO MUTATE BY ANTIGENIC SHIFT, FORMING NEW SUBTYPES OR STRAINS. THE NOVEL VIRUS SUBTYPES USUALLY HAVE CHANCES OF SPREADING GLOBALLY. INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE HAS A MONITORING AND INFORMATION-SHARING MECHANISM WORLDWIDE FOR THE EVOLUTION OF INFLUENZA AROUND THE WORLD UNDER THE AUSPICES OF THE GLOBAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM (GISRS), COORDINATED BY THE WORLD HEALTH ORGANISATION (WHO) GLOBAL INFLUENZA PROGRAMME (GIP). NIGERIA BEING A MEMBER OF THE GISRS AND ONE OF THE MAJOR EXPORTERS OF POULTRY IN WEST AFRICA HAS BEEN CONDUCTING INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE OVER THE LAST 14 YEARS.AN INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM, NATIONAL INFLUENZA SENTINEL SURVEILLANCE (NISS), WAS ESTABLISHED IN 2008 TO PROVIDE TIMELY EPIDEMIOLOGICAL AND VIROLOGICAL DATA TO BETTER INFORM NATIONAL PREVENTION AND CONTROL STRATEGIES INCLUDING IMMUNISATION. THE NISS AIMS TO FACILITATE EARLY DETECTION, NOTIFICATION, ASSESSMENT, AND RESPONSE TO ANY AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA OUTBREAKS IN NIGERIA.LEVERAGING THE EXISTING NISS SYSTEM IN THE COUNTRY, THIS PROJECT WILL SEEK TO: ?PRIMARILY DEFINE, CHARACTERISE AND MONITOR TRENDS OF AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZAS AND DEATHS ATTRIBUTABLE TO INFLUENZA-LIKE ILLNESS (ILI) AND SEVERE ACUTE RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS (SARI) FROM SEPTEMBER 30 TH, 2021 TO SEPTEMBER 29TH, 2026; IDENTIFY LOCALLY CIRCULATING INFLUENZA TYPES, SUBTYPES AND STRAINS, AND THEIR RELATIONSHIP WITH THE GLOBAL AND REGIONAL PATTERNS BETWEEN SEPTEMBER 30TH, 2021 AND SEPTEMBER 29TH, 2026?ESTABLISH A ONE-HEALTH PLATFORM TO INVESTIGATE, RESPOND TO, MITIGATE AND MONITOR THE IMPACT OF CONTROL STRATEGIES BETWEEN SEPTEMBER 30TH, 2021 AND SEPTEMBER 29TH, 2026.?PROGRAMMATICALLY MANAGE THE PROJECT TO ACHIEVE THE SET OBJECTIVES, INCLUDING ADMINISTRATIVE AND FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT; AND ENSURE MUTUAL SUSTAINABLE COLLABORATION WITH THE US CDC AND OTHER RELATED PARTNERS.THE FOLLOWING EXPECTED SHORT AND LONG TERM OUTCOMES WOULD BE ACHIEVED ON THE PROJECT: ?PUBLISHED REVISED NISS PROTOCOL COVERING BOTH AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE?REGULARLY UPDATED STANDARD OPERATION PROCEDURES (SOPS) FOR ALL FIELDS, SENTINEL SITES, NCDC SURVEILLANCE AND NISS LAB NETWORK?ESTABLISHED INFLUENZA LAB NETWORKS?EFFICIENT SORMAS DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM FOR INFLUENZA?INTEROPERABLE ANIMAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH DATA AND INFORMATION SHARING?REGULAR AND MUTUAL ONE-HEALTH MEETING ON INFLUENZA?REGULARLY REVISED AND UPDATED NATIONAL PANDEMIC INFLUENZA PREPAREDNESS  (NPIP) PLAN?EFFICIENT MONITORING AND EVALUATION MECHANISM FOR THE PROJECT?S PROGRESS?EFFICIENT PROCUREMENT OF REAGENTS, CONSUMABLES AND ALL MEDICAL SUPPLIES AND COUNTERMEASURES REQUIRED FOR NISS MANAGEMENT AND NPIP RESPONSE; AND EFFICIENT FINANCIAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT SYSTEM. ?FINALLY, AN INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM WITH THE CAPABILITIES TO RESPOND TO AVIAN, PANDEMIC INFLUENZA AND EMERGING RESPIRATORY HIGH THREAT PATHOGENS WOULD HAVE BECOME WELL-ESTABLISHED IN NIGERIA.

SUSTAINING AND IMPROVING SURVEILLANCE OF HUMAN AND ANIMAL INFLUENZA AND OTHER RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS IN GHANA. (SHARPEN-FLU) - ABSTRACT INFLUENZA REMAINS A DISEASE WHICH POSES A HUGE GLOBAL PUBLIC HEALTH THREAT. MAINLY BECAUSE INFLUENZA VIRUSES CAN CAUSE DEVASTATING PANDEMICS WITH THE MOST DEVASTATING TO DATE BEING THE SPANISH `FLU? PANDEMIC, WHICH LED TO THE DEATH OF ~40 MILLION PEOPLE WORLDWIDE. THE RECENT COVID-19 PANDEMIC HAS EMPHASIZED THE NEED FOR CONSTANT SURVEILLANCE FOR RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS SUCH AS INFLUENZA AND EMERGING AND RE-EMERGING PATHOGENS LIKE SEVERE ACUTE RESPIRATORY SYNDROME CORONAVIRUS-2 (SARS-COV-2). EARLY DETECTION AND CHARACTERIZATION OF THESE RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS IS THE KEY TO MITIGATING THEIR EFFECTS. THE NOGUCHI MEMORIAL INSTITUTE FOR MEDICAL RESEARCH (NMIMR) WITH SUPPORT FROM THE GHANA HEALTH SERVICE (GHS) AND THE UNITED STATES NAVAL MEDICAL RESEARCH UNIT (US NAMRU#3), STARTED SURVEILLANCE FOR INFLUENZA VIRUSES IN GHANA IN 2007; WHEN OUTBREAKS OF HIGHLY PATHOGENIC AVIAN INFLUENZA A H5N1 AMONG POULTRY LED TO THE DEATH AND CULLING OF THOUSANDS OF BIRDS. THIS SENTINEL SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM PROVIDES EPIDEMIOLOGIC AND VIROLOGIC DATA ON CIRCULATING INFLUENZA VIRUS STRAINS IN THE COUNTRY. IT IS ALSO ABLE TO DETECT AND RESPOND TO INFLUENZA OUTBREAKS. THROUGH THIS ESTABLISHED INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM, GHANA IS ABLE TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE WHO GLOBAL INFLUENZA AND SURVEILLANCE RESPONSE SYSTEM (GISRS) BY UPDATING DATA ON THE WHO FLUNET AS WELL AS SUBMITTING SAMPLES TO THE WHO CC IN LONDON. AGAIN, THE NMIMR COLLABORATES WITH THE VETERINARY SERVICES DIRECTORATE (VSD) TO CONDUCT SURVEILLANCE FOR AVIAN INFLUENZA AMONG POULTRY IN SELECTED AREAS IN THE COUNTRY. ALTHOUGH THE ESTABLISHED SENTINEL SYSTEM HAS BEEN EXTREMELY USEFUL, THERE ARE A FEW CHALLENGES. THIS SYSTEM IS HEAVILY BIASED TOWARDS INFLUENZA VIRUSES. THIS CURRENT COVID-19 PANDEMIC HAS DEMONSTRATED THE NEED TO INCLUDE OTHER NON-INFLUENZA RESPIRATORY VIRUSES AS WELL AS BACTERIAL PATHOGENS TO BE ABLE TO HAVE A ROBUST SYSTEM THAT CAN DETECT EARLY THREATS. AGAIN, DUE TO REGIONAL RE-ORGANIZATION, SOME N EW REGIONS CURRENTLY DO NOT HAVE INFLUENZA SENTINEL SURVEILLANCE SITES. THERE IS THE NEED THEREFORE TO EXPAND TO INCLUDE DETECTION OF OTHER PATHOGENS AS WELL AS INVOLVE NEW REGIONS AND PRIMARY HEALTHCARE FACILITIES. FURTHERMORE, THERE IS AN URGENT NEED FOR CLOSE COLLABORATIONS WITH THE VSD FOR IMPROVED CONTINUOUS SURVEILLANCE AMONG ANIMAL POPULATIONS AS MOST EMERGING AND RE-EMERGING PATHOGENS ARE ZOONOTIC IN NATURE. ULTIMATELY IN ORDER TO BE ABLE TO DETECT THREATS EARLY, A HOLISTIC ONE HEALTH APPROACH, WITH COLLABORATIONS AND DATA SHARING AMONG ALL INTEREST GROUPS IS IMPORTANT. THIS NOTICE OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITY PROVIDES GHANA WITH THE UNIQUE CHANCE TO EXPAND INFLUENZA AND OTHER RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS SURVEILLANCE IN GHANA IN ORDER TO BE ABLE TO CHARACTERIZE AND MONITOR RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS AMONG BOTH HUMANS AND ANIMALS; WHILE STRENGTHENING COLLABORATIONS AND COMMUNICATION AMONG INTEREST GROUPS FOR ADEQUATE UTILIZATION OF DATA TO PREVENT OR MITIGATE EFFECTS OF OUTBREAKS AND PANDEMICS.

SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA BY NATIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITIES OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES - THE COTE D'IVOIRE INFLUENZA SENTINEL SURVEILLANCE NETWORK WAS ESTABLISHED IN 2006 WITH TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL SUPPORT FROM CDC ATLANTA. THIS NETWORK HAS CONFIRMED THE CIRCULATION OF INFLUENZA A AND B VIRUSES AND HAS PLAYED AN IMPORTANT ROLE IN DETECTING OUTBREAKS OF THIS DISEASE. SINCE 2020, THE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM HAS BEEN PLAYING A MAJOR ROLE IN THE COVID-19 CONTROL IN TERMS OF SARS-COV-2 DETECTION AND RESPONSE ACTIVITIES. IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN THE CAPACITY OF THE CURRENT SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM AND IMPROVE ITS PERFORMANCE, THE CDC TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE OF CONSIDERABLE HELP.THIS PROJECT AIMS TO IMPROVE THE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM FOR INFLUENZA AND OTHER RESPIRATORY DISEASES FOR EARLY DETECTION OF EPIDEMICS AND RAPID RESPONSE UNDER THE ONE-HEALTH APPROACH. EACH COMPONENT OF THE PROJECT HAS BEEN CONSIDERED WITH EXPECTED SHORT- AND LONG-TERM OUTCOMES.FOR COMPONENT 1 (INFLUENZA CORE ACTIVITIES) EXPECTED SHORT- AND LONG-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE: ASSESSING THE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM, ESTABLISHING COORDINATION WITH THE MINISTRY OF AGRICULTURE, ESTABLISHING A NATIONAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM INTEGRATING EPIDEMIOLOGICAL AND LABORATORY DATA, AND SHARING CIRCULATING VIRUS STRAINS WITH WHO AND CDC COLLABORATING CENTERS.WITH RESPECT TO COMPONENT 2 (NON-INFLUENZA VIRAL AND BACTERIAL RESPIRATORY AND VACCINE-PREVENTABLE PATHOGEN), EXPECTED SHORT- AND LONG-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE ASSESSING THE NON-INFLUENZA RESPIRATORY DISEASE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM, IMPROVED CAPACITY OF THE EARLY WARNING SYSTEM THROUGH INTEGRATED AND EVENT-BASED SURVEILLANCE, STRENGTHENED MECHANISMS FOR TRANSPORT OF NON-INFLUENZA VIRAL BIOLOGICAL SAMPLES, IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR DETECTION AND CHARACTERIZATION OF OTHER RESPIRATORY VIRUSES, AND AVAILABILITY OF THE VIRAL RESPIRATORY DISEASE PANDEMIC PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE PLAN.WITH REGARD TO COMPONENT 3 (RAPID RESPONSE TO INFECTIOUS DISEASE OUTBREAKS OR OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EME RGENCIES), MAIN EXPECTED SHORT- AND LONG-TERM RESULTS INCLUDE CAPACITY BUILDING FOR THE PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY OPERATIONS CENTER, RAPID CONTROL OF EPIDEMICS, AND CAPACITY BUILDING FOR THE COUNTRY IN EARLY WARNING, MITIGATION AND MANAGEMENT OF NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL HEALTH RISKS.IN THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS PROJECT, THE NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF PUBLIC HYGIENE WILL MAINLY COLLABORATE WITH PASTEUR INSTITUTE OF COTE D'IVOIRE, LA NOUVELLE PHARMACIE DE LA SANTE PUBLIQUE, THE LABORATORY OF THE MINISTRY OF AGRICULTURE, THE DIRECTORATE OF HEALTH INFORMATION AND THE ONE HEALTH PLATFORM.

STRENGTHENING SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA BY NATIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITIES OF BURKINA FASO (2021-2026) - HUMAN INFLUENZA WAS NEGLECTED BEFORE 2009 IN BURKINA FASO, DESPITE THE 3 TO 5 MILLION CASES OF RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS AND 250,000 TO 500,000 DEATHS WORLDWIDE. INDEED, IN BURKINA FASO, HUMAN INFLUENZA WAS NOT INCLUDED IN THE LIST OF DISEASES UNDER SURVEILLANCE. IN ADDITION, DESPITE THE LARGE NUMBER OF LOCAL CHICKENS RAISED PER YEAR (44 MILLIONS) IN BURKINA FASO, AVIAN INFLUENZA AND OTHER POULTRY DISEASES ARE NOT SUBJECT TO SYSTEMATIC VETERINARY SURVEILLANCE. TWO OUTBREAKS OF AVIAN INFLUENZA (H5N1) OCCURRED IN 2006-2007 AND 2015, RESULTING IN AN ECONOMIC LOSS OF AT LEAST US$8 MILLION TO POULTRY FARMS EACH OUTBREAK. WITH TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL SUPPORT FROM NAMRU-3 CAIRO, CDC ATLANTA, AND USAID, A NATIONAL INFLUENZA REFERENCE LABORATORY (NIRL) WAS IMPLEMENTED BY THE MINISTRY OF HEALTH AND BEGAN THE HUMAN INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE IN 2009.AT THE BEGINNING OF THE SURVEILLANCE, ONLY INFLUENZA-LIKE ILLNESS (ILI) WAS MONITORED IN TWO SENTINEL SITES (LESS THAN 600 SPECIMENS ANALYZED PER YEAR) AND THE PREVALENCE OF INFLUENZA WAS 6.7%. WHEN SURVEILLANCE WAS EXPANDED TO INCLUDE SEVERE ACUTE RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS (SARI), AT FOUR NEW SITES (OVER 800 SPECIMENS PER YEAR), THROUGH THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FUNDED BY CDC ATLANTA, IN 2016, INFLUENZA PREVALENCE INCREASED TO 16.57%. NIRL REGULARLY SENT SPECIMENS TO THE WHO COLLABORATING CENTER FOR INFLUENZA, CDC ATLANTA. THE TECHNICAL PLATFORM OF NIRL HAS IMPROVED SIGNIFICANTLY YEAR AFTER YEAR: NIRL DETECTED FOR THE FIRST TIME, BY MOLECULAR BIOLOGY, H5N1 AVIAN INFLUENZA IN 2006, HUMAN INFLUENZA A (H1N1)PDM 09 IN 2009, DENGUE IN 2014 AND 2016 AND COVID-19 IN 2020 IN BURKINA FASO. THE OCCURRENCE OF COVID WITH ITS ECONOMIC AND HEALTH CONSEQUENCES HAS CONTRIBUTED TO REDUCE THE EFFORTS FOR SUSTAINABILITY OF INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE BY THE MINISTRY OF HEALTH. IT IS THEREFORE IMPERATIVE TO RESUME SURVEILLANCE OF INFLUENZA AND UNUSUAL RESPIRATORY EVENTS IN ORDER TO CONSOLIDATE THE ACHIEVEMENT AND PURSUE THE EFFORT FOR THE SUSTA INABILITY. THE NECESSITY TO STILL REINFORCE THE WEAK LABORATORY CAPACITY, THE LOW SKILL LEVEL OF HUMAN RESOURCES AND THE INSUFFICIENCY OF INTRA- AND INTERSECTIONAL COLLABORATION ARE MAJOR GAPS FOR THE SUSTAINABILITY OF THE CURRENT SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROPOSAL WHICH INCLUDE INFLUENZA CORE ACTIVITIES AND NON INFLUENZA ACTIVITIES IS TO REQUEST CDC PARTNERSHIP IN SUPPORTING THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES FOR BURKINA FASO :  I) TO REINFORCE THE CAPACITY OF BURKINA FASO FOR ROUTINE INFLUENZA AND OTHER RESPIRATORY DISEASE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS, TO MONITOR, DETECT, RESPOND AND MITIGATE TRANSMISSION; II) TO IMPROVE THE COUNTRY CAPACITY FOR NON-INFLUENZA VIRAL AND BACTERIAL RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS SURVEILLANCE AND COORDINATION OF THE NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL PARTNERSHIPS OF THE SURVEILLANCE PROGRAMS TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITIES OF THE COUNTRY TO DETECT RESPOND POTENTIAL OUTBREAKS; III) TO PARTICIPATE FULLY IN THE GLOBAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM (GISRS) BY PROVIDING SAMPLES TO THE WHO INFLUENZA COLLABORATING CENTERS TO THE ANNUAL VACCINE STRAINS SELECTION. TO REACH THESE OBJECTIVES THE PROJECT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED AND CONDUCTED IN AN INTRA- AND INTERSECTIONAL COLLABORATION BY SEVERAL LOCAL STRUCTURES AND INSTITUTION : THE MINISTRY OF HEALTH, THE MINISTRY IN CHARGE OF ANIMAL HEALTH, THE ONE HEALTH PLATE-FORM OF BURKINA FASO, ...

INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE NETWORKS AND RESPONSE TO SEASONAL AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA: MONITORING AND MAINTENANCE, MEXICO. 2021-2022 - IN MEXICO, THE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM UNDER THE SENTINEL MODEL WAS CREATED IN 2006; THIS MODEL ONLY PERFORMED EPIDEMIOLOGICAL SURVEILLANCE OF INFLUENZA IN OUTPATIENT CASES. DURING THE 2009 HEALTH CONTINGENCY, INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE OF AMBULATORY AND HOSPITALIZED CASES BEGAN IN THE 32 ENTITIES OF THE COUNTRY. IT IS ESTIMATED THAT INFLUENZA CAUSES BETWEEN THREE AND FIVE MILLION SEVERE CASES AND 290,000 TO 650,000 DEATHS ANNUALLY WORLDWIDE.THE INFLUENZA EPIDEMIOLOGICAL SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM (SISVEFLU) IN OUR COUNTRY HAS GIVEN GOOD RESULTS, HOWEVER, LIKE ANY SYSTEM, IT IS NECESSARY TO REINFORCE IT THROUGH REENGINEERING, BASED ON THE ANALYSIS OF THE PROCESSES AND NEEDS THAT ARISE IN EPIDEMIOLOGICAL SURVEILLANCE, ESPECIALLY BY APPLYING THE CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT TECHNOLOGIES FOR THE QUALITY OF SERVICES;  IN THE SAME WAY, IT IS IMPERATIVE TO MAINTAIN LABORATORY DIAGNOSIS, FOR THE CHARACTERIZATION OF CIRCULATING VIRUSES IN THE NATIONAL TERRITORY. FOR THIS REASON, COLLABORATION WITH INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS SUCH AS MEXICO-UNITED STATES FOUNDATION FOR SCIENCE (FUMEC), THROUGH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF PROJECTS HAS REPRESENTED AN IMPORTANT AREA OF OPPORTUNITY FOR STRENGTHENING THE OPERATION OF THE EPIDEMIOLOGICAL AND LABORATORY SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS OF INFLUENZA IN OUR COUNTRY FOR SEVERAL YEARS.PROJECTS THAT TRANSLATE INTO SPECIFIC SURVEILLANCE ACTIONS FOR THIS DISEASE THAT LEAD TO THE GENERATION OF EPIDEMIOLOGICAL INFORMATION FOR DECISION-MAKING TO GUIDE CONTROL ACTIONS AND MITIGATE POTENTIAL DAMAGE TO THE HEALTH OF THE POPULATION.

IMPROVING INFLUENZA  PROGRAM AND ENHANCING INFLUENZA AND OTHER VIRAL RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS THROUGH INTEGRATION OF ALL EXISTING SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS AND USING ONE HEALTH SURVEILLANCE APPROACH - THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO SUPPORT THE INFLUENZA PROGRAM AND INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE MAINTENANCE THROUGH INTEGRATION OF ALL EXISTING SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS AND USING ONE HEALTH SURVEILLANCE APPROACH. THE PROJECT WILL USE THE REGIONAL APPROACH TO BUILD A SUSTAINABLE MODEL INFRASTRUCTURE OF INFLUENZA PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND SURVEILLANCE AND COUNTRY SPECIFIC FINANCIAL SUSTAINABILITY PROGRAM AND SURVEILLANCE PLANS.DIFFERENT COMPONENTS OF SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM SUCH AS ILI AND SARI SURVEILLANCE AND VIROLOGICAL OR OTHER SYNDROMIC SURVEILLANCE WILL BE REVISED BASED ON LESSONS LEARNED DURING THE CURRENT PANDEMIC AND USED TO INTEGRATE THE DETECTION OF INFLUENZA AND OTHER RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS. THE NIC WILL STRENGTHEN THE LABORATORY CAPACITIES TO PERFORM INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE ALL YEAR AROUND AND FOR OTHER VIRAL RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS, MAINTAIN THE QUALITY ASSURANCE AND SHARE MORE THAN ONCE PER YEAR INFLUENZA AND OTHER VIRAL IMPORTANT PATHOGEN STRAINS AND ENSURE FULL PARTICIPATION IN THE WHO GLOBAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM (GISRS).THE PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE STRENGTHENING OF DATA MANAGEMENT AND IMPROVE THE TIMELINES OF COUNTRIES REPORTING TO FLUNET AND THE EUROPEAN SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM -TESSY AS WELL AS IMPROVE DATA ANALYSIS FOR INFORMED DECISION MAKING AND TRIGGER TIMELY PUBLIC HEALTH MEASURES LIKE NON PHARMACEUTICAL INTERVENTIONS AND VACCINE USE. SECID WILL COORDINATE WITH COUNTRIES NATIONAL AUTHORITIES MAINLY PUBLIC HEALTH INSTITUTE AND VIROLOGY LABORATORIES,WHO,CDC AND ECDC,FOLLOW UP AND SUPERVISE THE SHARE OF INFLUENZA DATA IN COUNTRIES PLATFORM AND IN FLUNET SYSTEM AND SAMPLES WILL BE SHARED WITH WHO COLLABORATING CENTERS IN LONDON AND CDC AT LEAST ONCE PER YEAR AND TO INCREASE THEIR SAMPLING AND TESTING, LEADING TO MORE CONTRIBUTION TO THE BIANNUAL STRAIN SELECTION FOR VACCINES. ALL THE PARTICIPATING SEE COUNTRIES WILL PREPARE ROUTINE JOINT ANIMAL HUMAN INTERFACE (AHI)/ONE HEALTH REPORTS BY RESPECTIVE HUMAN AND ANIMAL HEALTH NATIO NAL OR SUBNATIONAL COUNTRY STRUCTURES ON CURRENT SITUATION AND ACTIVITIES TO CONTINUE THE ESTABLISHED COLLABORATION AND ENSURE STRONG CONNECTION TO AND COMMUNICATION WITH THE MINISTRY OF AGRICULTURE (MOA) AND OTHER ANIMAL HEALTH STRUCTURES.

ENHANCEMENT OF INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE NETWORKS AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN, PANDEMIC, SEASONAL AND NON-INFLUENZA IN PAKISTAN - INFLUENZA VIRUSES ARE SIGNIFICANT HUMAN RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS THAT CAUSE BOTH SEASONAL, AND PERIODIC, UNPREDICTABLE PANDEMICS. ANIMAL AND HUMAN INFECTIONS BY H5N1 HIGHLY PATHOGENIC AVIAN INFLUENZA VIRUSES IN VARIOUS ASIAN COUNTRIES INCLUDING PAKISTAN (DECEMBER, 2007) HAVE HEIGHTENED CONCERNS ABOUT THE EMERGENCE OF FUTURE PANDEMICS. THERE IS AN EVER INCREASING NEED FOR ESTABLISHMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A COUNTRY WIDE REPORTING AND MONITORING SYSTEM FOR EARLY DETECTION OF SUCH OUTBREAKS/CASES AND STRENGTHEN THE LOCAL AND REGIONAL RESPONSE CAPACITIES . DURING THE FIRST COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PERIOD 2004-2009, DESPITE A DELAYED START AND VARIOUS SOCIO-POLITICAL HURDLES IN IMPLEMENTATION THEREOF, SIGNIFICANT/APPRECIABLE PROGRESS HAS BEEN MADE TOWARDS ESTABLISHMENT OF A SENTINEL SURVEILLANCE NETWORK FOR INFLUENZA AT THE PROVINCIAL LEVEL THAT CAN SERVE AS A BENCH MARK FOR FURTHER ENDEAVORS. AS THE APEX PUBLIC HEALTH LABORATORY AND WHO ACCREDITED NATIONAL INFLUENZA CENTER IN PAKISTAN; WITH SUSTAINED SUPPORT FOR INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE, NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF HEALTH CAN CONTINUE TO SUCCESSFULLY FOSTER LAB BASED SURVEILLANCE NETWORK FOR INFLUENZA AND INDIRECTLY FOR OTHER INFECTIOUS DISEASE OF PUBLIC HEALTH CONCERN.THE FUNDS ARE BEING REQUESTED TO HELP STRENGTHEN THE NATIONAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE NETWORK ENABLING IT TO EFFECTIVELY DETECT, RESPOND, PREVENT, AND CONTROL SEASONAL, NOVEL INFLUENZA VIRUSES AND NON-INFLUENZA (VIRAL, BACTERIAL) PATHOGENS. PAKISTAN HAS IMPLEMENTED A SUCCESSFUL MODEL SENTINEL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE ESTABLISHED SINCE 2007 UNDER VARIOUS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS WITH CDC. THIS GRANT WILL ENABLE SUPPORT ROBUST AND TIMELY SURVEILLANCE FOR SEASONAL INFLUENZA AND ENSURE SUSTAINABLE SYSTEMS IN PLACE FOR RAPID DETECTION AND RESPONSE TO POSSIBLE PANDEMIC INFLUENZA IN LINE WITH WHO?S GLOBAL INFLUENZA STRATEGY 2021-2030. THE GOAL IS TO UTILIZE THE FUNDS FOR ALL THE THREE COMPONENTS INCLUDING INFLUENZA NON-INFLUENZA AND PANDEMIC PREPAREDNESS FOR  AVIAN AND PANDEMIC POTENTIAL PATHOGENS;A) TO STRENGTHEN SURVEILLANCE, DETECTION AND RESPONSE CAPACITIES FOR SEASONAL AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZAB) IMPLEMENT ENHANCED SURVEILLANCE ACTIVITIES FOR NON-INFLUENZA VIRAL AND BACTERIAL RESPIRATORY AND VACCINE-PREVENTABLE PATHOGENC) SUPPORT AND STRENGTHEN PANDEMIC PREPAREDNESS AND RAPID RESPONSE CAPACITY TO INFECTIOUS DISEASE OUTBREAKS OR OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES
SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA BY NATIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITIES OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES - 2021

SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA BY NATIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITIES OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES - SINCE 2016, UKRAINE HAS IMPLEMENTED A SENTINEL SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM FOR INFLUENZA LIKE ILLNESS (ILI) AND SEVERE ACUTE RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS (SARI) CARRIED OUT THROUGHOUT THE YEAR, ADDITIONALLY TO THE ROUTINE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM WHICH IS CARRIED OUT DURING THE INFLUENZA SEASON ONLY (WEEKS 40-20).  INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE IS REGULATED BY THE MOH ORDER ? 1126 DATED 17.05.2019 ?ABOUT APPROVAL THE PROCEDURE FOR EPIDEMIOLOGICAL SURVEILLANCE OF INFLUENZA AND ACUTE RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS, AND MEASURES FOR PREPAREDNESS IN THE INTEREPIDEMIC PERIOD AND RESPONSE DURING AN EPIDEMIC SEASON?. THIS ORDER WAS DEVELOPMENT WITH SUPPORT OF WHO COUNTY OFFICE IN UKRAINE AND WAS DISCUSSED WITH WHO EURO AND AGREED UPON.BUT STILL THE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM HAS (1) LIMITED HUMAN RESOURCES AT NATIONAL LEVEL TO PROVIDE INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE NETWORK, (2) LIMITED CAPACITIES FOR EXPANSION OF WEB BASED ELECTRONIC REPORTING SYSTEM TO THE LEVEL OF SENTINEL SITES, (3) LIMITED HUMAN RESOURCES AT REGIONAL LEVEL TO PROVIDE OUTBREAK PREPAREDNESS.THE PROJECT ?SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA BY NATIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITIES OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES? PROPOSED BY PUBLIC HEATH CENTER OF THE MINISTRY OF HEALTH OF UKRAINE AIMS TO MAINTENANCE OF NATIONAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM AND STRENGTHEN THE DEVELOPMENT OF NATIONAL CAPACITY TO DETECT AND RESPOND INFLUENZA EPIDEMICS AND PANDEMICS; SUPPORT COORDINATION AND COMMUNICATION OF THE ANIMAL HUMAN INTERFACE AND FACILITATING THE CAPACITY TO DETECT AND MONITOR NOVEL VIRUSES OCCURRING IN ANIMALS; SUPPORT CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT TO DETECT AND RESPOND TO THE SPREAD OF NON-INFLUENZA RESPIRATORY VIRUSES AND BACTERIA. IT IS ALSO ANTICIPATED TO RESPOND TO A DECLARED PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY OR IDENTIFIED HIGHLY INFECTIOUS DISEASE OUTBREAKS, AS WELL TO STRENGTHEN NATIONAL CAPACITY TO DETECT AND RESPOND INFLUENZA EPIDEMICS AND PANDEMICS.AS OUTCOMES OF THE PROJECT IT ENVISAGED NATIONAL SURVEILLANCE OBJECTIVES ESTABLISHED AND PUBLISHED ; IMPROVED COMMUNICATION BETWEEN MOH AND MOA ANIMAL INFLUENZA OUTBREAKS AND/OR HUMAN CASES OF ZOONOTIC (NOVEL) INFLUENZA VIRUS; COUNTRY OWNERSHIP OF AND SUSTAINABILITY OF INTEGRATED SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM; STRONG, CAPABLE DATA-DRIVEN SURVEILLANCE WORKFORCE; IMPROVED USE OF SURVEILLANCE DATA TO INFORM PUBLIC HEALTH ACTIONS; SUSTAINED ABILITY TO MONITOR THE SEVERITY OF EPIDEMIC AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA ASSOCIATED ILLNESSES; IMPROVED AWARENESS AND RESPONSE TO ZOONOTIC (NOVEL)INFLUENZA HUMAN INFECTIONS; WELL PREPARED AND ESTABLISHED LABORATORY TESTING AND SURVEILLANCE PROGRAM; DATA AVAILABLE FOR ANALYSIS ON INFLUENZA SEASONALITY AND SEVERITY AND IDENTIFICATION OF NOVEL VIRUSES; IMPROVED INTERNATIONAL CONTRIBUTION OF SPECIMEN DATA USED FOR VACCINE COMPOSITION DECISION-MAKING (VCM); INCREASED CAPACITY TO IDENTIFY NEW AND EMERGING INFLUENZA VIRUSES IN ANIMALS AND HUMANS, AND ABILITY TO IDENTIFY PANDEMIC THREATS.

SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA BY NATIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITIES OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES - THE MAIN PROJECT GOAL IS TO MAINTAIN ESTABLISHED INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM AND ALL CAPACITIES BUILT AND ESTABLISHED IN GEORGIA WITHIN THREE PREVIOUS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS TO DETECT, MONITOR, RESPOND AND MITIGATE TRANSMISSION OF NOVEL INFLUENZA VIRUSES. IT WILL ALSO ENABLE NATIONAL CENTER FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PUBLIC HEALTH OF GEORGIA TO MAINTAIN THEIR WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION (WHO) NATIONAL INFLUENZA CENTER (NIC) LABORATORY AND TO FULLY PARTICIPATE IN THE WHO GLOBAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM (GISRS) BY SHARING SPECIMENS AND CLINICAL AND EPIDEMIOLOGIC DATA ON DISEASE RELATED TO THE CIRCULATION OF INFLUENZA. THE PROPOSAL WILL BE ADDRESSING FOUR MAJOR STRATEGIES: 1. INFRASTRUCTURE, 2) EPIDEMIOLOGICAL SURVEILLANCE, 3) LABORATORY SURVEILLANCE AND 4) PANDEMIC PREPAREDNESS. TO ACHIEVE THE GOAL THE FOLLOWING SCOPE OF WORK WILL BE PERFORMED: 1) TO IMPROVE HEALTH SYSTEM WORKERS KNOWLEDGE IN INFLUENZA ISSUES, TRAINING MATERIALS WILL BE PREPARED AND ROUND OF TRAININGS WILL BE CONDUCTED THROUGHOUT THE COUNTRY BY NCDC SPECIALISTS; 2) DATA COLLECTED THROUGHOUT THE YEAR WILL BE ANALYZED TO PRODUCE WEEKLY, MONTHLY AND AN ANNUAL REPORTS; DATA WILL BE UPLOADED ON NCDC WEB-SITE (WWW.NCDC.GE) ON WEEKLY BASIS; 3)  ILI, SARI AND VIROLOGICAL SENTINEL SITES WILL OPERATE ACCORDING TO STANDARD PROTOCOLS AND BE RESPONSIBLE TO PROVIDE SAMPLES AND EPIDEMIOLOGICAL DATA; TO MONITOR SENTINEL SITES FUNCTIONING ACCORDING TO STANDARD PROTOCOLS THE PROJECT MANAGEMENT UNIT WILL EVALUATE THEM BY ONSITE VISITS; 4) NATIONAL INFLUENZA CENTER WILL BE PROVIDED WITH ALL REAGENTS AND SUPPLIES NECESSARY FOR PERMANENT AND APPROPRIATE FUNCTIONING IN A ROUTINE REGIME AND IN TERMS OF INCREASED WORKLOAD; 5) NCDC GEORGIA WILL REPORT ANY NOVEL OR UNSUBTYPABLE INFLUENZA A TO NATIONAL AUTHORITIES AND WHO AND SHIP SPECIMENS OR ISOLATES WITHIN ONE WEEK TO A WHO COLLABORATING CENTER AND CDC; AND WILL CONTINUE SENDING VIRUS ISOLATES OR RT-PCR POSITIVE SPECIMENS TO A WHO COLLABORA TING CENTER AT LEAST TWO TIMES A YEAR; 6) NCDC GEORGIA WILL CONTINUE PROVISION OF INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE DATA ON WEEKLY BASIS TO TESSY AND WEEKLY REPORTS TO THE MINISTRY OF HEALTH, PARTNERS WITHIN THE COUNTRY, UPON REQUEST TO  CDC; 7) NCDC STAFF WILL PARTICIPATE WITH CDC?S INFLUENZA DIVISION IN RELEVANT MEETINGS, ASSESSMENTS, DISCUSSIONS AND OTHER OPPORTUNITIES AS THEY MAY ARISE IN CASE OF FUNDING AVAILABILITY. NCDC GEORGIA WILL COLLABORATE WITH CDC ATLANTA (GEORGIA COUNTRY OFFICE) WITH WHO/ECDC, WHO REGIONAL OFFICE TO AGREE ALL PROPOSED ACTIVITIES AND TRAINING MATERIALS; NIC GEORGIA SENDS POSITIVE SPECIMENS TO WHOCC LONDON AS RULE TWICE PER YEAR. IN CASE OF CDC REQUEST AN ADDITIONAL PACKAGE OF POSITIVE ORIGINAL CLINICAL SPECIMENS WILL BE SENT TO CDC ALSO. NCDC GEORGIA FULLY PARTICIPATES IN THE WHO GLOBAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE SYSTEM (GISRS). REPORTS/ABSTRACTS ON LAB AND EPIDEMIOLOGICAL FINDINGS WILL BE PRESENTED AT DIFFERENT MEETINGS AND CONFERENCES. THE MAJOR OUTCOME WILL BE MAINTAINED INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM CAPABLE TIMELY DETECT, MONITOR, RESPOND AND MITIGATE TRANSMISSION OF NOVEL INFLUENZA VIRUSES. FOR THE FIRST PROJECT PERIOD ESSENTIAL OUTPUTS WILL BE: 1) TRAINED HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS WITH INCREASED THEIR KNOWLEDGE ON INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE, PREVENTION AND OUTBREAK RESPONSE 2) DEVELOPED AND SHARED WEEKLY, MONTHLY AND ANNUAL INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE DATA BY UPLOAD ON NCDC WEB-SITE (WWW.NCDC.GE) 3) MAINTAINED SENTINEL SITES OPERATE ACCORDING TO STANDARD PROTOCOLS AND APPROPRIATELY COLLECTED SAMPLES AND RELEVANT EPIDEMIOLOGICAL DATA PROVIDED; 4)WELL FUNCTIONING NIC, PRODUCED LAB DATA; 5) FEEDBACK REPORTS FROM WHOCC ON RECEIVED POSITIVE SPECIMENS FROM NIC GEORGIA; 6) PRESENCE OF TIMELY DATA IN TESSY DATABASE; 7)INFLUENZA SURVEILLANCE DATA PRESENTED DURING MEETING WITH CDC?S INFLUENZA DIVISION.

SURVEILLANCE AND RESPONSE TO AVIAN AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA BY NATIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITIES OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES - ENHANCED SURVEILLANCE FOR HUMAN AND ZOONOTIC VIRAL RESPIRATORY PATHOGENS WILL PROVIDE EARLY RECOGNITION OF NEWLY EMERGING POTENTIALLY PANDEMIC STRAINS AND RAPID RESPONSES TO EMERGING VIRUS. THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ARE: TO ESTABLISH INTER-SECTORAL COLLABORATION BETWEEN THE MOH, MOA AND NICS; INCREASE THE PROFESSIONAL LEVEL OF ALL PARTICIPANTS TO TIMELY DETECT EMERGING PANDEMIC PATHOGENS; TO MAINTAIN ROUTINE AND SENTINEL SURVEILLANCE TO IDENTIFY RISK GROUPS FOR SARI, DETERMINE NEW VARIANTS OF INFLUENZA AND SARS-COV-2 VIRUS AND EVALUATE VACCINE EFFECTIVENESS; TO ASSESS THE IMPACT OF SEASONAL INFLUENZA, SARS-COV-2 AND OTHER RESPIRATORY VIRUSES; TO USE NGS TECHNOLOGY FOR INFLUENZA, SARS-COV-2 AND RSV GENOMIC ANALYSIS; TO PRESENT WEEKLY, INTERIM AND ANNUAL REPORTS TO THE MOH, WHO AND WHO CC; TO UPLOAD ANALYTICAL DATA TO FLUNET, FLUID AND TESSY AND SHARE NEW VIRUSES WITH CDC&P. AS A RESULT, GISRS ACTIVITIES IN GENERAL WILL BE ENHANCED AND HEALTH, SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC IMPACTS OF PANDEMIC AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES WILL BE REDUCED.

IMPLEMENTATION OF A PACKAGE OF CARE USING POINT OF CARE TESTING FOR HIV DIAGNOSIS, CD4 COUNT AND DETECTION OF FUNGAL AND OTHER OPPORTUNISTIC INFECTIONS IN ARGENTINA. - IMPLEMENTATION OF A PACKAGE OF CARE USING POINT OF CARE TESTING FOR HIV DIAGNOSIS, CD4 COUNT AND DETECTION OF FUNGAL AND OTHER OPPORTUNISTIC INFECTIONS IN ARGENTINA.  JUSTIFICATION: IN ARGENTINA, MORE THAN ONE THIRD OF PEOPLE LIVING WITH HIV (PLHIV) ARE DIAGNOSED IN LATE STAGES OF THE DISEASE (ADVANCED HIV [AH]). IMPROVED ACCESS TO EARLY DIAGNOSIS OF HIV AND WIDESPREAD AVAILABILITY OF POINT OF CARE (POC) TESTS, COULD INCREASE THE PROPORTION OF INDIVIDUALS RAPIDLY STARTING ANTIRETROVIRAL THERAPY (ART), AND REDUCE THE INCIDENCE OF OPPORTUNISTIC INFECTIONS SUCH AS HISTOPLASMOSIS, CRYPTOCOCCOSIS, TUBERCULOSIS (TB), AMONG OTHERS. RAPID HIV TESTS, USUALLY BASED ON LATERAL FLOW TECHNOLOGIES, HAVE SEVERAL ADVANTAGES OVER LABORATORY-BASED DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS INCLUDING SIMPLICITY, PORTABILITY, AND RAPID TURNAROUND FOR RESULTS. WHO AND LOCAL GUIDELINES RECOMMEND THE INITIATION ART AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AFTER HIV DIAGNOSIS, INCLUDING SAME-DAY INITIATION WHEN FEASIBLE AND ACCEPTABLE. IN AIDS PATIENTS WITH MENINGEAL CRYPTOCOCCOSIS OR TB WITH CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM INVOLVEMENT, IMMEDIATE ART INITIATION IS ASSOCIATED WITH A HIGHER FREQUENCY OF ADVERSE OUTCOME, AS COMPARED WITH LATER INITIATION. THE USE OF HIGHLY SENSITIVE AND SPECIFIC TESTS TO RAPIDLY DIAGNOSE DISSEMINATED TB AND/OR CRYPTOCOCCAL INFECTION MAY SIGNIFICANTLY CONTRIBUTE TO THE IDENTIFICATION OF PATIENTS WHO ARE NOT CANDIDATES FOR IMMEDIATE, SAME-DAY ART INITIATION. DUE TO THE HIGH MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY ASSOCIATED WITH THESE OPPORTUNISTIC INFECTIONS IN THE CONTEXT OF HIV AND THE LIMITATIONS OF THE AVAILABLE TESTS FOR RAPID DIAGNOSIS, OUR OBJECTIVE IS TO MONITOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF AN IMMEDIATE, SAME-DAY ART INITIATION PROGRAM. A PACKAGE OF SEQUENTIAL POC ASSAYS WILL BE IMPLEMENTED, INCLUDING RAPID DIAGNOSIS OF HIV INFECTION IN PEOPLE WHO DO NOT KNOW THEIR STATUS, OR THE DETERMINATION OF THE IMMUNE STATUS ON PEOPLE WITH HIV; FOLLOWED BY THE RAPID SCREENING OF OPPORTUNISTIC INFECTIONS, HISTOPLASMOSIS, CRYPTOCOCCOSIS AND TB.  STUDY DESIGN: WILL BE A PROSPECTIVE STUDY AIMED TO EVALUATE THE FEASIBILITY OF IMPLEMENTATION OF A HIV PACKAGE OF CARE STRATEGY IN AN INFECTIOUS DISEASES OUTPATIENT FOLLOWING UP UNIT. THE FIRST PHASE WILL CONSIST OF TWO YEARS OF THIS STUDY IMPLEMENTATION AT THE HOSPITAL DR. JUAN A. FERNÁNDEZ, LOCATED IN BUENOS AIRES, ARGENTINA. ACCORDING TO THE PHASE ONE RESULTS, A SECOND PHASE (YEARS 3 TO 5) WILL BE PROPOSED, AND WILL INCLUDE OTHER MEDICAL CENTERS OF THE AUTONOMOUS CITY OF BUENOS AIRES. OUR LONG TERM GOAL IS TO IMPLEMENT THIS STRATEGY ACROSS THE WHOLE ARGENTINEAN TERRITORY. STUDY PROCEDURES INCLUDE: 1) CLINICAL DATA COLLECTION; 2) RAPID HIV INFECTION CONFIRMATION (HIV-RDT); 3) POC FOR IMMUNOLOGICAL STRATIFICATION; 4) POC FOR SCREENING OF HISTOPLASMOSIS (HAG-LFA), CRYPTOCOCCOSIS (CRAG-LFA) AND TB (LAM-LFA) AMONG SYMPTOMATIC INDIVIDUALS AND ASYMPTOMATIC INDIVIDUALS WITH A CD4=200 CELLS/ΜL; 5) STANDARD OF CARE PROCEDURES; 6) MANAGING AND CLINICAL DECISIONS; AND 7) STAFF TRAINING.  ANALYSIS PLAN: THE GENERAL OBJECTIVE WILL BE EVALUATED THROUGH THE FOLLOWING INDICATORS: A) FEASIBILITY: AVAILABILITY OF RESOURCES AND STAFF TRAINING TO IMPLEMENT THE PROPOSED ALGORITHM. B) EFFICIENCY: LABORATORY AND CLINICAL INDICATORS.
